Title: Global Cyber Security Officer
Description:
Overview

Welcome diversity and apply as you are!

At Adisseo, we cherish the value of diversity whatever it may be.

The Information Security Leader is accountable for the security of our Information Systems, Industrial equipments and IOT. He will work closely with executive management, IT teams, Legal function and other stakeholders to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the organization's data and information systems and drive our compliance to NIS2.

Responsibilities

Develop and Implement Information Security Strategy: Lead the development, implementation, and maintenance of an effective information security strategy aligned with business objectives and regulatory requirements.Risk Management: Identify, assess, and prioritize information security risks to the organization's data, systems, and processes. Develop and implement risk mitigation plans and controls to minimize exposure.Security Governance: Establish and maintain information security policies, standards, and procedures. Provide guidance and oversight to ensure adherence across the organization.Security Architecture, Design and Implementation: Ensure that security is integrated into the design and implementation of systems, applications, and infrastructure. Identify the adequate security solutions required, drive the solutions selection, lead their implementations within the IT infrastructure.Security Operations: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the information security function, including security monitoring, incident response, vulnerability management, and security awareness training. Develop and maintain an incident response plan. Lead the investigation and resolution of security incidents, breaches, and violations. Structure crisis management procedure and run frequent crisis exercises.Compliance and Audit: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS). Coordinate internal and external audits and assessments. Ensure quality communication and exchanges with authority in every country we operate in. Build a network of qualified ISS correspondents in the most important countries.Security Awareness and Training: Develop and deliver security awareness and training programs to educate employees about security best practices and promote a culture of security.Security Metrics and Reporting: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the effectiveness of the information security program. Prepare regular reports for executive management and stakeholders.

Qualifications

Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field with significant experience in information security leadership roles, with a demonstrated track record of success.Strong understanding of security frameworks, standards, and regulations. Including E-Bios methodology.Strong experience of Industrial IT & OT, and all the related security aspects the key infrastructure components (Active Directory, Cloud, Firewalls). Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization.Strong leadership and strategic planning abilities.Experience managing security incidents and investigations.Fluent French and English are a Must

Title: Cybersecurity Operations Officer
Description:
With more than 20 years of proven expertise, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering cutting-edge, analytics-driven enterprise software solutions across 35+ countries worldwide. Our comprehensive technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organisations, and beyond.

We are looking for an ambitious Cyber Security Operations Officer to join our growing Information and Cyber Security Team in our Headquarters, in Athens.

Reporting to the Cybersecurity Architecture & Operations Manager, the successful candidate will be responsible for the following day-to-day Cybersecurity Operations.

Responsibilities:

Conduct daily monitoring, threat detection, and incident response;Coordinate onboarding efforts for new systems on the SIEM platform;Assist on creation of SIEM uses cases;Assist with Security Incident Management processes;Contribute to internal audits and help generate SOC metrics and reports;Coordinate penetration tests and analyze the results;Coordinate remediation efforts for vulnerabilities;Support the enforcement of Secure SDLC within development teams;Assist in the design and implementation of Information Security Operating Models (Technology Related);Assist in the daily operations of our Privilege Access Management solution;Identify, communicate and manage current and emerging security threats with relevant stakeholders;Assist in information security risk assessments to identify existing vulnerabilities and future threats;Promote a culture of security awareness across the organization;Participate in security-related projects, ensuring they are delivered on time and within scope;Stay updated with the latest industry trends, threats, and regulatory changes;Ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements and supporting the continued implementation of the Group Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy


Requirements

MSc in Information Security or equivalent;At least 4 years of experience of dedicated Cyber Security experience relevant to the SOC Analyst, Cyber Security Engineer, Penetration Tester, Cyber Security Operations Specialist;Information Security Industry certifications i.e. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CySA+), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH);Excellent organizational analytical and problem-solving skills;Fluency in English


Benefits


Your Life @ Qualco

As a #Qmember, you'll embody our values every day, fostering a culture of teamwork & integrity, passion for results, quality & excellence, client focus, and agility & innovation. Within a truly human-centered environment built on mutual respect and trust, your dedication to our shared vision will not only be recognized but also celebrated, offering boundless opportunities for your personal and professional growth.

üí∏ Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs.

Title: Info Security Officer
Description:
As the Information Security Officer (ISO) of Total Soft, one of the leading software developer firms in Romania, you will play a key role in ensuring the protection of our systems and data and those of our customers. You will work alongside a talented team to develop and implement cybersecurity strategies.

Responsibilities:

 Driving internal InfoSec projects and strategic initiatives to help change for the future; Development of security policies and procedures for the company, and its service and software delivery organizations; Conducting security analyses, certifications, re-certifications and audits involving a wide variety of international InfoSec compliance programs, such as ISO27001, NIS, SOC, etc. Developing and implementing InfoSec policies and procedures Providing customized consulting and solutions to clients Monitor national and European InfoSec regulations and drive innovative solutions to ensure that our business remains compliant;

What you need to succeed:

 Bachelor's Degreepreferably in IT, Engineering, Cybersecurity or other related fields; Previous experience in a similar role (minimum 2-3 years);; Deep experience in developing detailed plans and driving through strategic initiatives aligned with InfoSec best practices; Excellent written and verbalcommunication skills (Romanian and English) with an ability to clearly communicate ideas and results on all organizational levels; Analytical thinking, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills; Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment

Company Description

TotalSoft is the preferred ERP solutions provider in Romania and one of the top 10 global providers of software solutions for the leasing industry. TotalSoft‚Äôs top products, Charisma ERP, Charisma HCM are market leader products in Romania, with relevant references in 8 industries: financial services, retail, distribution, production, construction, agriculture, medical and services.

Currently, TotalSoft has a team of +500 software specialists and projects in 45 countries on 4 continents.

For more information, please access: totalsoft.ro, charisma.ro and logo.com.tr/en.

Title: Security Officer - Ballymount
Description:
Securitas Security Services Ireland are currently recruiting Security Officers for our client based in the Dublin 12 area.

Pay rate for this role is ‚Ç¨14.50 per hour*

This is a Monday - Sunday day shift position from 8h to 18h.

All Securitas interviews are conducted online via video call*

Benefits:

Full-time 30 hours a week contract of employment with the ability to work up to 48 hours per week 24 hour EAP (Employee Assistance Programme) free confidential counselling and advice supporting our employees in a number of areas. Employer Contribution Pension Scheme from the day you join the CompanyProgression, training and development opportunitiesChristmas Savings SchemeDiscounted Private Healthcare Scheme (Cash back on everyday medical costs, such as dental check-ups, optical, GP and Emergency Department visits.)Internal recognition schemesBicycle to work scheme from the day you join the Company (Save up to 52% on a bike and accessories)Group Scheme (Access to hundreds of discounts from well-known brands and retailers, as well as access to hundreds of high-quality online education courses from some of the world's leading learning institutions.)Employee Refer a friend incentivesLife Assurance equal to one year's basic pay as per Employment Regulation Order (ERO)Overtime as per the EROSick Pay Scheme as per EROSIPTU Representation RightsSubstantial Maternity Leave top up payment

Main purpose of position:

To protect our customer's property, people and/or assets by providing security services to a specific site in direct accordance with the sites published Assignment Instructions (AI's) and any subsequent changes.

Expectations of this position:

Fully and satisfactorily complete all of the training that has been agreed is necessary for the particular site. Fully and satisfactorily complete all of the tasks and duties on site as defined within the published Assignment Instructions (AI's). Proactively refer to and review the published Assignment Instructions, thus familiarising oneself with any changes and in order to suggest changes that can proactively improve or enhance the level of service. Look out for, and to immediately report, any Health & Safety hazards, or potential hazards, on site. Title: Security Officer
Description:
Adviseer, implementeer en borg cybersecuritymaatregelen met gebruik van erkende normen, standaarden en frameworks zoals ISO 27001, NEN 7510, CIS Controls en COBIT.
In de wereld van IT, OT en cybersecurity speel je als Security Officer een cruciale rol. Je bent mede verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen, implementeren van beveiligingsbeleid en het beheren van risico‚Äôs binnen de organisatie van onze opdrachtgevers.Je wordt betrokken bij beveiligingsincidenten en co√∂rdineert het herstel bij dreigingen. Daarnaast houdt de Security Officer toezicht op naleving van regelgeving zoals de AVG en beheert het ISMS (Information Security Management System). Ook zorg je voor security awareness om medewerkers bewust te maken van risico‚Äôs. Regelmatige audits en risicoanalyses helpen om beveiligingsmaatregelen continu te verbeteren.
Een voorproefje van je uitdagingen
Adviseren van onze opdrachtgevers over cyberrisico's en de bijbehorende maatregelen.Uitvoeren van interne audits en risicoanalyses.Opstellen, implementeren, beheren en verbeteren van het cybersecuritybeleid, inclusief de bijbehorende procedures, processen en maatregelen.Zorgdragen voor borging van cybersecurity awareness, of misschien vind je het zelfs leuk om als mystery guest een bedrijfsbezoekje te brengen.Samenwerken met het team van onze opdrachtgevers.
Waarom het zo leuk is?
Aansluiten bij ons team van cybersecurityspecialisten met 22 jaar ervaring biedt kansen.Bij VEST pionieren we onder andere in ons eigen laboratorium en onderzoeken we IT- en OT-casussen met maatschappelijke impact, zoals, zonnepanelen, laadpalen, laadpassen, stoplichten, openbare camera‚Äôs etc. En beschikken we over een eigen Vest intelligence Agency (VIA).Samen de toekomst verkennen en je adviseert onze opdrachtgevers over de ontwikkelingen.Naast de projecten voor opdrachtgevers krijg je de mogelijkheid om je eigen idee√´n te presenteren. Dit kan bijvoorbeeld ook via video of podcast, deze productie hebben we volledig in eigen beheer.Je werkt samen met zeer interessante opdrachtgevers in sectoren zoals vervoer, energie, overheidsorganisaties, grote (academische) ziekenhuizen en de luchtvaartsector.Hybride werken? Die mogelijkheid wordt jou ook geboden.Je vakantiedagen kunnen oplopen tot 30 dagen per jaar bij een fulltime dienstverband. Hoe dat werkt? Leggen we je graag uit. Je sluit je aan bij een werkgever die meedenkt met jouw persoonlijke situatie; alles is bespreekbaar.Voer je opdrachten uit voor grootse opdrachtgevers, maar kom je thuis in een hecht team van circa 40 pioniers.Deel en vergaar kennis met je collega‚Äôs; hiervoor hebben we ook speciale momenten en faciliteiten gepland. Mobiliteitsvergoeding, bijvoorbeeld een leaseauto of een andere optie die bij jouw persoonlijke situatie past.Opleidingen en trainingen worden gestimuleerd.Vast contract bij goed functioneren na proeftijd.
Klinkt goed, toch?
Wat verwachten we van jou?
Brede interesse in cybersecurity, je bent er eigenlijk altijd wel mee bezig.Enige ervaring met securityprojecten in een vergelijkbare rol, zoals Security Officer of IB-specialist.E√©n of meerdere security gerelateerde certificeringen (bijv. CISA, CISSP, CISM) of de bereidheid deze te halen.Voldoende kennis van en ervaring met een of meerdere van de volgende standaarden, frameworks en regelgeving: ISO 27001, NEN 7510, CIS, NIST, COBIT, NIS2 en DORA.Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels (zowel mondeling als schriftelijk).
Over VestBij VEST krijg je de kans om organisaties te helpen beschermen tegen cyberdreigingen en bij te dragen aan de digitale transformatie. Sluit je aan bij een hecht team van pioniers en goeroes voor wie security veel meer is dan alleen een baan. Deel en vergaar kennis, werk in diverse omgevingen bij verschillende opdrachtgevers en geniet van leuke activiteiten met je nieuwe collega's.
‚ÄúIk heb voor Vest gekozen omdat ons vakgebied dynamisch en omvangrijk is. Juist bij Vest kan ik altijd rekenen op de expertise en aandacht van mijn collega‚Äôs. Samen zijn wij Vest!‚ÄùAlex - Security OfficerWil jij ook een eigen avatar?Zet jouw schaakstuk in het spel van cybersecurity. Of je nu strategisch als de koningin, krachtig als de toren, behendig als het paard, veelzijdig als de loper of cruciaal als de pion wil zijn, bij VEST ben jij een onmisbare speler in ons winnende team. Maak het verschil in de wereld van cybersecurity.
Enthousiast geworden?
Mis dit niet, deze baan is in trek, dus reageer direct!
Wil je eerst meer info? We vertellen je hier graag meer over Vest onder het genot van een kopje koffie of zelf gebrouwen biertje, of bel met Imme +31(0)6 21457304

Title: ICT Security Officer
Description:
About Safello

Safello is the leading cryptocurrency exchange in the Nordics, committed to making digital assets more accessible and secure for investors. As part of our vision to build the next-generation crypto bank, we are now looking for an ICT Security Officer to take ownership of our end-to-end security. At Safello, we work relentlessly, around the clock, to make crypto accessible to everyone while ensuring compliance and security at every step.

The Role

In this role, you will be the driving force behind Safello‚Äôs security posture‚Äîsafeguarding day-to-day operations, maintaining governance and compliance standards, and shaping strategic security initiatives that protect our systems, employees, and customers. You will report to the CTO and collaborate closely with executive leadership (CEO, CTO, CCO), product teams, and other stakeholders to ensure robust, agile, and compliant security practices across the organization.

Key Responsibilities

 Safeguard Security Across the Organization:

Oversee security for day-to-day company operations‚Äîencompassing company premises, employee devices, password management, access control, data encryption, secure code practices, and threat modeling. Coordinate and handle incident response and management to protect sensitive data and maintain business continuity.

 Drive Governance and Compliance within ICT:

Develop and implement cybersecurity policies and practices in line with frameworks such as DORA, NIS2, EBA, and ESMA guidelines. Work on incident management, business continuity, and third-party risk management to ensure compliance with evolving regulations.

 Operate Strategically and Practically:

Collaborate with executive leadership to define overall security strategy, while partnering with product teams to implement hands-on solutions that mitigate threats and maintain a high-security environment.

 Foster a Culture of Security:

Champion best practices across the organization, providing training, documentation, and guidance for secure onboarding/offboarding processes.

Who You Are

 Experienced Professional: 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity and information security, ideally in high-security or regulated industries. Technical Expertise: Solid understanding of device management, hardware keys, secure offboarding/onboarding, ACLs, encryption, database security, and overall end-to-end security operations. Regulatory Familiarity: Exposure to relevant regulations (DORA, NIS2, EBA, ESMA) with the ability to integrate compliance and governance into day-to-day processes. (Deep expertise is a plus, but not mandatory.) Strategic & Hands-On: Skilled at translating high-level policy requirements into practical technical standards and solutions. Incident Management: Proficient in developing and executing incident response plans, ensuring swift mitigation and recovery. Fintech or Regulated Background: Previous experience in fintech or financial services is highly desirable. Cryptography & Blockchain: Comfort with cryptography concepts and interest or experience in blockchain technology and cryptocurrency infrastructures. Educational Background: Degree in a STEM field or equivalent practical experience.

Why Join Us?

 Flexible B2B Contract: Enjoy autonomy in your schedule and invoicing, including Swedish public holidays off without deductions. Cutting-Edge Equipment: We provide all necessary hardware and software tools. Fully Remote: Work from anywhere at CEST timezone overlap, with the option to visit our Stockholm office. Growth & Impact: Be part of a fast-growing company where you can significantly influence the future of financial systems and digital asset infrastructure.

How To Apply

If you are excited about advancing security in the rapidly evolving crypto landscape, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your CV/Resume and any relevant documentation or references demonstrating your security expertise. We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so apply today to help us uphold the highest security standards at Safello!

Basic Computer Skills Are Required.

Title: Security Risk Officer
Description:
Meritis is an IT consulting, management and development firm founded in 2007, with offices in Paris, Sophia-Antipolis, Aix-en-Provence, Montpellier, Toulouse, Nantes, Lille, ... And now Lisbon! Our mission? To connect the best talents with companies, and give them a head start.
We support our customers in all their digital transformation needs through a wide range of areas of expertise: Software Engineering, Finance, Project Management, Devops, Data, Cloud, Cybersecurity and Agility.
We are active in the banking, insurance, telecommunications, industry and transport sectors, and today 40% of CAC40 companies are Meritis customers.
Backed by our values of high standards, humility, benevolence and proximity, we now employ over 900 people.
We make it a point of honor to be close to our employees and to provide them with individualized support, whatever their position within the company.
Certified Great Place To Work since 2013, our concept of well-being at work goes far beyond a simple label, and it's our employees who speak best of it: https://www.glassdoor.fr/Avis/Meritis-Avis-E1163008.htm.

Job Description:First Line of Defense, IT Risk Management (ITRM) team plays a strategic role within our organization by monitoring topics related to IT Risks and by establishing operational standards in accordance with organizational policies, ensuring their effective implementation.This team responsibilities also encompass reporting cyber and IT risk issues, developing action plans, and defining and implementing policies related to IT Asset Management (ITAM) and EoL/Obsolescence. Furthermore, we actively monitor obsolescence and vulnerabilities, supervise LoD1 controls, and assess the state of CIB & Risks, particularly in areas such as developer training on security, code vulnerabilities, and Checkmarx deployment.In alignment with our global structure, this position will provide updates on the AMER region's status regarding these topics.
Main Tasks & Responsibilities:Communicate corporate governance, risk management, control strategies, frameworks, and policies.Communicate effectively with stakeholders, including senior management, to report on the status of technological risks, potential vulnerabilities, and the effectiveness of risk mitigation measures.Report on enterprise-wide technology risks to senior management.Provide independent oversight and challenge of IT team choices.Provide training tools and advice to your perimeters and promote a strong risk management culture.Ensure that activities comply with applicable laws and regulations.Identify potential technological risks that could impact the bank's operations, including cybersecurity threats, data breaches, system failures, and other IT-related risks.Assess the potential impact and likelihood of technological risks and work to quantify and prioritize these risks based on their severity and potential impact on the bank's operations.Continuously monitor and analyze the bank's technology infrastructure and systems to identify any emerging risks or vulnerabilities that could pose a threat to the bank's operations and data security.Ensure that the bank's technology systems and operations comply with relevant regulatory requirements and industry standards, such as data protection regulations and cybersecurity best practices.Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies and controls to address identified technological risks, including collaborating with IT teams to implement security measures and controls. Contribute to the development and implementation of technology risk management policies and procedures to ensure the bank's technology infrastructure is secure and resilient. Specific Responsibilities:Develop and maintain the technology risk management framework, policies, and procedures.Communicate effectively with stakeholders, including senior management, to report on the status of technological risks, potential vulnerabilities, and the effectiveness of risk mitigation measures.Provide training, tools, and advice to staff members to promote a strong risk management culture and awareness of technology risks.Develop and maintain comprehensive reports on technological risks, vulnerabilities, and risk mitigation measures for senior management and stakeholders. Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fieldProven experience in technology risk management within the banking or financial services industry.Strong understanding of technology infrastructure, security principles, and risk assessment methodologies.Knowledge of regulatory requirements and industry standards related to technology risk management.Experience with Power BI and Excel.Knowledge of Splunk is a plus.Knowledge of COBIT and ITIL framework is a plus.Relevant certifications such as ISO27001, ISO27005, CISSP, CISM, or CRISC are a plus.English level minimum B2Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.Creative and proactive.Results oriented.Comfortable communicating with various stakeholders and senior management. If you are a proactive and results-oriented IT professional, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Additional information:
Are you ready to take on new challenges within an environment conducive to well-being?
Being a consultant at Meritis means:Evolving in a company where learning is encouraged: certification training, e-learning, meetUp, code competitions, career paths, etc;Being part of communities of experts who share their knowledge and experience;Choice of project;Benefit from a network of clients who trust us and whom we have built up over the years;Work in a friendly environment with a lot of events: lunches, afterworks, teambuilding, annual parties, etc;Join a company where it's good to work, certified "Great Place to Work".
Our differences are our assets. That's why Meritis is committed to diversity and non-discrimination. All our jobs are accessible to people with disabilities.
We look forward to hearing from you. You can contact ethiquegroup@meritis.fr if you believe you are a victim or witness of discrimination.

Title: Industrial Cybersecurity Officer (f/m/d) for Hydrogen Business
Description:
A Snapshot of Your Day 

In your new role as Industrial Cybersecurity Officer (f/m/d) in hydrogen business, you bring in your knowledge and experience in assuring cyber-resilience of our green hydrogen electrolyzer systems as well as in our new giga-factory. You are involved into our highly motivated and innovative engineering, R&D and manufacturing teams. In this role you define the strategy and way forward based on the existing maturity and risk assessment. Within Siemens Energy you will be part of a strong cybersecurity network, and you adapt methods to the new business of green hydrogen systems. Furthermore, you will have the chance to influence the industrial standards for this new and innovative technology.

How You‚Äôll Make An Impact

Develop and maintain a cybersecurity strategy for hydrogen business portfolio (products, solutions, services), manufacturing and production sites, and business managed ITImplement the cybersecurity strategy for hydrogen business to continuously improve cybersecurity maturitySupport information security for hydrogen business, in the interest of a holistic cybersecurity approachIdentify and implement necessary cybersecurity setup and resourcesMeasure organizational unit‚Äôs cybersecurity maturity based on defined KPIsIdentify cybersecurity market requirements such as regulatory demand or the need for cybersecurity certificationGuide and coordinate Industrial Cybersecurity Experts and Cybersecurity Ambassadors


What You Bring

Successfully completed scientific or technical studies in the field of information technology, electrical engineering, automation engineering or comparableWide-ranging knowledge in Cybersecurity and Information SecurityPractical experience in the management and operation of IT systems and infrastructure is of advantageExperience and knowledge of the organization and products within Siemens Energy Sustainable Energy Systems is of advantageStrong analytical thinking, communication and presentation skills; ability to work independently as well as in teamsAdvanced project management skillsAdvanced Business language level in English


About The Team

Our Transformation of Industry division is decarbonizing the industrial sector. Increasing

electrification and efficiency are key and demand for green H2 and derivative fuels will rise.

We enable decarbonization of the industrial sector and the transition to sustainable processes, building on a strong industrial customer base, a global network, diverse technologies, and

integrated execution capabilities

Who is Siemens Energy? 

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. With ~100.000 dedicated employees in more than 90 countries, we develop the energy systems of the future, ensuring that the growing energy demand of the global community is met reliably and sustainably. The technologies created in our research departments and factories drive the energy transition and provide the base for one sixth of the world's electricity generation.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character ‚Äì no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits

In addition to an attractive remuneration package in line with the market, you can expect an attractive employer-financed company pension schemeWe also offer the opportunity to become a Siemens Energy shareholderWe offer our employees the opportunity to work flexibly and remotely, and our inspiring offices provide space for collaboration and creativityThe professional and personal development of our employees is very important to us. We provide them with the opportunities to learn and develop in a self-determined way, various attractive programmes and learning materials are available for this purposeIn relation to the "compatibility of family and work", we have a wide range of offers, e.g. flexible working time models, childcare places at many locations, the possibility of trial part-time work or even a sabbatical 


We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.

Title: Cyber Security Officer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:
DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.
At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.
We are looking for a Cyber Security Officer, for a project based in Lisbon. 
Responsabilities:Contribute to the drafting and implementation of security policies.Analyze technologies' security risks (data security, identity and access security, cloud‚Ä¶), security tools and services, assess their impacts and make recommendations.Participate in the development of security policies and organizational guidelines.Ensure that policies are aligned with the organization‚Äôs objectives.Collaborate with cyber & IT teams.Work with all cyber and IT teams.Support operational teams in the implementation of cyber action plan. Reporting to management.Develop security indicators and dashboards for the perimeter.Supervise the testing and validation of internal security controls as directed by the CISO or the internal audit team. Support the CISO in animating the AI & Data Cyber Governance.Support the CISO in committee preparation & Community animation. Assist in creating a comprehensive overview of the Applications managed by this department, including a precise inventory of the Risks Assessments, Security documentations, and other pentests associated with each of these Applications.Follow up, in coordination with the department's ITRO, the transfer of legacy AP codes and associated Risks (CMDB & GRC) into the ServiceNow structure attached to A3I.Participate to the Risk Assessments of Solutions offered by A3I.Assist in monitoring the department's Risk remediation plans and in setting up the risks Committees.Contribute to improving the security governance of the Group solutions proposed by A3I.Review the access requests submitted by A3I‚Äôs Staff (Iwave, MyAccess, Mobisubscribe, etc.).
Requirements:10 years of professional experience in cybersecurity. Good understanding of AI, its potential and impact, and a good knowledge of infrastructure security. IT risk management and analysis. National Institute of Standards and Technology Cybersecurity Framework (NIST), cyber risk analysis frameworks (e.g.: EBIOS RM) or methodology as ISO 27001. Ability to collaborate / teamwork. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Rigor, attention to detail and ability to act as critical thinker. Client focus. Adaptability skill.Good level of English.
If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to or liliana.moreno@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúLM/Cyber Security Officer‚Äù.

Title: Retail Security Officer, Cork
Description:
Variable shift patterns which will include Dayshifts, Weekends

Shifts are 8-12 hours in duration

Free replenished uniform

‚Ç¨14.50 + Site Allowance

Sunday Premium

Who is Mitie?

Mitie provides a wide range of facilities management (FM) services across Ireland, Europe, and the UK. These are delivered as integrated FM contracts, in bundles or as single services, depending on client requirements. Our service areas include technical services, energy and building services, cleaning, security, front of house and consultancy.

We work with a wide range of private and public clients to create great work environments which resulted in Mitie winning 3 awards in the 2022 Facilities Management Awards, including Total FM Service Provider for the second year in a row.

Mitie have been awarded the IBEC KeepWell Mark in 2021 and 2022 for our commitment to employee wellbeing and we have also been named in the Top 100 Employers for Wellbeing in Ireland for two years in a row. We are proud of our diverse workforce and like to recognise our people through various reward and recognition schemes, as well as through learning and development.

Our premise is simple: the exceptional, every day.

About the role:

Reporting to the Mitie Regional Security managerRetail security officer assigned to a high end store/storesPro-actively ensuring the protection of employees, property and assets and accountability for store assignedCreating a safe and comfortable working environment for employees and visitors whilst carrying out critical duties. Responding to emergency situations as they arise and following the strict documented escalation processes in a calm concise manner. Accurately reporting all incidents. Monitoring and operating CCTV cameras and other recording systems for multiple sites and multiple operations. Ability to multitask and have attention to detail is crucialWorking 5 days over 7. Hours per shift will vary from a minimum of 8 to a maximum of 12 depending on location. Rosters are given 4 weeks in advanceFull training will be provided. 

About you:

Previous Retail Security Experience preferableValid PSA License5 years previous checkable work history. Be able to provide work references. Fluent in English with the ability to communicate without issue. Be dependable and available to work a regular work schedulePossessing a friendly, approachable personality. Smart and presentable appearance. Good IT skills for reporting. 

Company Benefits:

Free Virtual GP ServiceMi Recognition (Thanking employees for a job well done ranging from ‚Ç¨25 - ‚Ç¨250)Talent Referral Scheme (Earn ‚Ç¨100 - ‚Ç¨3000 for referring a friend to Mitie)Mi Deals (Fantastic savings at high street stores)Long service awards (Ranging from ‚Ç¨50-‚Ç¨300)10% health insurance discount for employees who join under the MITIE planA non-contributory life assurance schemePersonal Retirement Savings Account (PRSA) schemeEmployee Assistance Programme (EAP)Save as you Earn Scheme (a risk-free savings plan that allows you to buy Mitie shares at a special discount)Bike2Work SchemeTax Saver SchemeLearning & development (access to 200 courses on our L&D platform)

Ahead of being contacted by our Talent Team in relation to your application, we would like to inform you that you will need to provide the following documents if you successfully obtain a position with us:

Proof of right to workPhoto ID - A passport or driving licence is required as proof of ID. Proof of address dated in last 3 monthsBank Statement dated in last 3 monthsProof of PPS (Public Services Card is not accepted)Reference details PSA license. 

Mitie is an equal-opportunity employer

It does not attempt to detail every activity, and should be utilised as a general guide, detailing the minimum requirements and responsibilities of the position. Title: Security Officer - Cork region
Description:
Securitas Security Services Ireland are currently recruiting Security Officers based in the Cork Region. This role will be based between three different sites.

Own transport is essential for this position.

The pay rate is ‚Ç¨14.50 per hour plus night shift allowance of ‚Ç¨16.80 per shift and Sunday allowances of ‚Ç¨3.44 per hour.*

Benefits:

Full-time 36 hours a week contract of employment with the ability to work up to 48 hours per week 24 hour EAP (Employee Assistance Programme) free confidential counselling and advice supporting our employees in a number of areas. Employer Contribution Pension Scheme from the day you join the CompanyProgression, training and development opportunitiesChristmas Savings SchemeDiscounted Private Healthcare Scheme (Cash back on everyday medical costs, such as dental check-ups, optical, GP and Emergency Department visits.)Internal recognition schemesBicycle to work scheme from the day you join the Company (Save up to 52% on a bike and accessories)Group Scheme (Access to hundreds of discounts from well-known brands and retailers, as well as access to hundreds of high-quality online education courses from some of the world's leading learning institutions.)Employee Refer a friend incentivesLife Assurance equal to one year's basic pay as per Employment Regulation Order (ERO)Overtime as per the EROSick Pay Scheme as per EROSIPTU Representation RightsSubstantial Maternity Leave top up paymentAll Securitas interviews are conducted online via video call*

Main purpose of position:

To protect our customer's property, people and/or assets by providing security services to a specific site in direct accordance with the sites published Assignment Instructions (AI's) and any subsequent changes.

Expectations of this position:

Fully and satisfactorily complete all of the training that has been agreed is necessary for the particular site. Fully and satisfactorily complete all of the tasks and duties on site as defined within the published Assignment Instructions (AI's). Proactively refer to and review the published Assignment Instructions, thus familiarising oneself with any changes and in order to suggest changes that can proactively improve or enhance the level of service. Look out for, and to immediately report, any Health & Safety hazards, or potential hazards, on site. Stay alert to any threats or changes within the work environment in order to take the appropriate action in order to reduce the chance of disruption, loss or damage. Use common sense and initiative by immediately involving others if a situation appears to become threatening. Complete an accurate, detailed notebook entry as soon as possible after any incident, which can then be used as part of the Incident Report process. Wear the uniform provided correctly at all times, ensuring all items is clean and pressed. To maintain an excellent level of personal grooming and hygiene at all times. Maintain a helpful, interested and courteous approach to team members, customer's staff and the general public, as applicable in order to uphold a highly professional image. 

Security Officer Specification:

Good English essentialExcellent written and attention to detail skills are essentialGood level of P.C. skillsPrevious experience desirable, however training will be providedMust have excellent customer service and communication skillsBe flexible with your working hours. PSA Licence

These comprehensive benefits include discounted health care scheme, company pension, bike to work scheme, access to hundreds of discounts from well-known brands and retailers, access to hundreds of high-quality online education courses from some of the world's leading learning institutions, ways to save for the future, and other resources to improve health and well-being.

Title: Security Officer
Description:
Join our team!

 KBC Bank,  the parent company of the Hungarian K&H Bank, provides banking services in 5 European countries. The international IT solutions of the banking group, covering several European countries, takes place with Hungarian and Belgian colleagues in Hungary and Belgium, therefore not only our services are international, but also our teams. Our responsibilities range from day-to-day operation to application development and its operation.  We are constantly expanding the Hungarian side of the team,  which is why we are looking for enthusiastic, motivated new employees with junior, medior or possibly senior work experience.

The IT directorate S2E (Service 2 Employee) manages the world of "your digital workplace" and therefore steers - together with Corporate HR, Facility Management and Communication - the digitalization of all KBC employees. As part of a financial institution, KBC attaches great importance to security, which is why this is a responsibility that is shared by every employee. Our IT Systems Engineers, who build and maintain the KBC ICT systems, are particularly concerned about the security and robustness of systems and applications. This vacancy is part of the "Unified Security Team" in the IT directorate S2E. The US Team ensures that every KBC user and IT developer can use their daily business applications as efficiently as possible, in a modern and secure way, i.e. in a 'future proof' and secure environment. Our focus is infrastructure (endpoint) protection; from build, over support and finally maintaining the solution.

 What you can expect working with us: 

 You can make sure your future career is steady within our company  Life-long learning and plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself  Competitive salary as well as other benefits such as: 
 10% customizable cafeteria,  annual performance-based reward,  company phone with mobile internet, that you can use for private purposes as well  employee discount at the bank 

 Your English language skills won‚Äôt be worn out as you can use it on a daily basis  Flexible schedule as we don‚Äôt use ‚ÄòClock in Clock out‚Äô system  As our focus is on teamwork we consider it important to hang out in the "open office" together, but you have the option to spend more than half of your working hours from home  We value your insight and are always open to suggestions  International environment with a cheerful work atmosphere  Green office in Millennium Park, equipped with: 
 bicycle storage and showers  restaurant with panoramic views over the Danube and the National Theatre  free coffee in our community area where we hang out and play darts, and many dining options in the surrounding area 


 What your job will be: 

 Liaison between various risk and security departments and operational teams .  Assisting with the development of the security governance and architecture .  Helping increase security awareness by setting up awareness campaigns and training .  Providing specialist advice to S2E teams on security and risk related matter .  Overseeing the identification, assessment, and management of risks.  Preparing and communicating risk assessment reports and monitoring the effectiveness of risk management measures .  Conduct IT risk assessments, IT control assessments, and compliance assessments.  Performing security maturity assessments .  Follow up on IT risks, controls, threats, and vulnerabilities.  Report test results and status of open actions to stakeholders.  Coordinate internal security audits and support internal and external audits.  Be involved in third-party risk assessments 


 What we expect from You: 

 Be ready to take ownership of the stability, performance and security of the new services and the different services our internal customers already use.  Ability to independently implement new services within a Windows environment . 


 What are your strengths? 

As an experienced System Engineer/IT professional, you possess the following skills:

 E xperience with MS Azure, MS Intune and MS Defender .  B road technical experience in Windows operating systems (WIN10-11).  B road technical experience in ‚Äúsecurity‚Äù tools .  P ractical experience with Antivirus, Endpoint Security, adaptive threat Detection setup, Host intrusion prevention and host firewall .  Being f amiliar with P owershell scripting and query languages (SQL, KQL)  G ood knowledge of security technologies with a view to integration, configuration and maintenance within a modern endpoint platform (Windows & Mobile devices (IOS & Android) )  E xpertise in a cloud environment is a skill that we are looking for the further development of our new workplace .  Previous experiences as reference .  C ommunicative and confident to take the lead in creating & implementing new services .  A b ility to work in a rapidly changing environment and constantly strive for improvement and quality .  F lexible and ability to quickly respond to unforeseen circumstances, last-minute adjustments and, sometimes tight deadlines . 


 What you can expect during the recruitment process: 

 After sending your CV in English, expect a three-round interview process, one online with our local recruiter, one online in English with the Belgian team leader, and the final round is in person at our office in Budapest (in Hungarian) to get to know each other better.  An efficient selection process is important for both of us, so we try to make it as fast as possible, and even if you are not selected we will give you a detailed feedback.

Title: Cyber Security Officer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Title: Security Officer - Wicklow
Description:
Securitas Security Services are currently recruiting Security Officers to be based in Rathdrum, Co. Wicklow.  ‚Ç¨15.60 per hour plus night shift allowance of ‚Ç¨12.60 per shift and Sunday allowance.

All Securitas interviews are conducted online via video call*

Primary function is the prevention of anything that is likely to cause loss, waste, damage or inconvenience to the client or its customers.

Benefits:

Substantial Maternity Leave top up paymentFull-time 36 hours a week contract of employment with the ability to work up to 48 hours per week 24 hour EAP (Employee Assistance Programme) free confidential counselling and advice supporting our employees in a number of areas. Title: Security officer
Description:
Wil jij bijdragen aan de beveiliging van informatie en data van mensen met aardbevingsschade? Zoek je een uitdagende functie waarin je je expertise kunt inzetten en verder kunt ontwikkelen? Lees dan verder!
Als Security Officer bij het Instituut Mijnbouwschade Groningen (IMG) ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de informatiebeveiliging binnen onze organisatie. Je speelt een belangrijke rol in het identificeren en mitigeren van risico‚Äôs binnen het IMG. Daarnaast ben je op de hoogte van de technologische ontwikkelingen en vertaal je die naar een actueel informatie beveiligingsbeleid of beschermingsmethodieken. Je zorgt ervoor dat technische richtlijnen en werkinstructies consistent worden nageleefd en up-to-date blijven. Door nauw samen te werken met je collega‚Äôs, ben je altijd goed op de hoogte van organisatieprocessen en de invloed op informatiebeveiliging. Je voorziet hen van advies om deze risico‚Äôs effectief te beheersen.Je zorgt ervoor dat onze applicaties voldoen aan de benodigde beveiligingsvereisten en waar nodig geef je ongevraagd advies. Jouw praktische aanpak en technische kennis maken je tot een onmisbare schakel in ons beveiligingsproces. Of je nu de logbestanden doorloopt, een SAAS-leverancier controleert op naleving van SLA-afspraken, of als aanspreekpunt optreedt bij verschillende overleggen, jij maakt beveiliging toegankelijk en begrijpelijk voor de organisatie.
Wat bieden wij jou?Een functie waarin je bijdraagt aan een belangrijk maatschappelijk doel: het beschermen van de gegevens van Groningers en Drentenaren met aardbevingsschade.Ruimte voor jouw professionele ontwikkeling door het volgen van relevante opleidingen en trainingen.Een team van professionals die samen de gegevensbescherming binnen het IMG waarborgen.Ruimte voor inspraak op technologische ontwikkelingen op het gebied van security.Een dynamische en afwisselende werkomgeving waarin het IMG zich continu ontwikkelt en jij steeds nieuwe uitdagingen tegenkomt.
Functie-eisenAls Security Officer draag je een grote verantwoordelijkheid met directe impact op de beveiliging van gevoelige informatie. Wij zoeken iemand die:
Beschikt over afgeronde hbo opleiding; bij voorkeur met een technische security achtergrond.Werkervaring heeft in informatiebeveiliging en/of securitymanagement.Relevante certificeringen heeft, zoals CISM of CISSP, of bereid is deze te behalen.Ervaring heeft met ISO 27001/27002.Indien mogelijk bekend is met de Baseline Informatiebeveiliging Overheid (BIO) (pr√©).In staat is praktische en passende oplossingen te bedenken voor uiteenlopende beveiligingsvraagstukken.Bekwaam is in het uitvoeren van risicoanalyses, leveranciersbeoordelingen en het managen van incidenten.De Nederlandse taal uitstekend beheerst, zowel in woord als geschrift
ArbeidsvoorwaardenSalarisniveau: schaal 11Maandsalaris: Min ‚Ç¨4.024 ‚Äì Max. ‚Ç¨6.110 (bruto)Dienstverband: Arbeidsovereenkomst voor bepaalde tijd met uitzicht op onbepaalde tijdContractduur: 1 jaarMinimaal aantal uren per week: 32Maximaal aantal uren per week: 36
Overige arbeidsvoorwaardenWij bieden een baan die ertoe doet. Jij maakt het verschil voor Groningers en Drenten met aardbevingsschade. Wat wij nog meer te bieden hebben? Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden en veel ruimte om jezelf te zijn en (door) te groeien. Een werkomgeving waar je blij van wordt. Met fijne collega's, want IMG'ers zijn betrokken bij de regio √©n bij elkaar.
Uitdaging en ontwikkelingHou je van verandering en een flinke uitdaging? Het IMG is altijd in beweging. En ons werk dus ook. Je hebt inhoudelijk interessant werk met volop ruimte om te leren en jezelf te ontwikkelen. Kansen die je ziet, kun je pakken.
Flexibel werkenJe krijgt veel ruimte en vertrouwen om je eigen werk in te delen. En om een goede balans te vinden tussen werk en priv√©. Als je functie het toelaat, kun je flexibel werken. Je kiest zelf waar je werkt, thuis of op kantoor in Groningen of Assen. Vaak werk je 1 of 2 dagen per week samen met je team op kantoor.
Betrokken collega‚ÄôsIMG‚Äôers hebben hart voor de Groningers en Drenten, maar ook voor elkaar. Collega‚Äôs voelen zich verbonden met elkaar en er heerst een fijne en informele werksfeer. Er is veel ruimte voor jou als persoon en we vinden het belangrijk dat jij jezelf kunt zijn.
Aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaardenBij de Rijksoverheid krijg je naast een prima salaris 144 vakantie-uren en 64 extra vrije uren (IKB-uren). Daarnaast krijg je een Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB) van 16,50% van je salaris. Hiermee kun je extra verlofuren opnemen, maar je kunt dit ook laten uitbetalen of er bijvoorbeeld een fiets voor woon-werkverkeer van kopen.
Onze arbeidsvoorwaarden in het kort:
36-urige werkweek144 vakantie-uren en 64 extra vrije uren (IKB-uren)IKB-budget van 16,50% van je salarisReiskostenvergoedingvergoeding voor je thuiswerkplekvergoeding voor het verduurzamen van je woning en de aanschaf van een fiets.
Wil je meer weten over werken bij het IMG of zelf IMG‚Äôer worden? Kijk dan op www.schadedoormijnbouw.nl/werkenbij.
Meer over jouw toekomstige afdelingDe afdeling Informatievoorziening is verantwoordelijk voor de invulling van de informatievoorziening en de daarbij behorende IT-voorzieningen van het IMG. Elke dag werken zo‚Äôn 240 collega‚Äôs aan slimme oplossingen waar bewoners met aardbevingsschade en collega‚Äôs echt iets aan hebben. Om mensen beter en sneller van dienst te kunnen zijn, werken we met low-code systemen en technieken als machine learning en AI. De afdeling IV bestaat uit vier teams: Architectuur, Ontwikkeling, Beheer en Informatiebeveiliging & Privacy.
Team Architectuur is verantwoordelijk voor data-, applicatie- en proces-architectuur. Dit team werkt vanuit de Project Start Architectuur (PSA).Team Ontwikkeling brengt nieuwe en veranderde informatiebehoeften in kaart. In dit team werk je nauw samen met de business en IT-leveranciers.Team Beheer werkt nauw samen met team Ontwikkeling. Beheer loopt mee met de ontwikkeling en de wijzigingen op de systemen en vertegenwoordigt de gebruikers in dit proces. Ook voor vragen en kleine verbeterwensen is team Beheer het eerste aanspreekpunt.Team Informatiebeveiliging & Privacy bewaakt de AVG en de informatiebeveiliging binnen het IMG.
Wil jij je breed ontwikkelen in een platte organisatie met een fijne werksfeer? Zet jouw ICT-talent in voor Groningers en Drenten met aardbevingsschade!
Instituut Mijnbouwschade Groningen (IMG)Het Instituut Mijnbouwschade Groningen (IMG) is het zelfstandig bestuursorgaan dat de schade afhandelt die is ontstaan door gaswinning in het Groningenveld en de gasopslagen Norg en Grijpskerk. Ga je bij ons in het Noorden aan de slag, dan kies je voor werk dat er √©cht toe doet.
Het IMG is diepgeworteld in de Groningse en Drentse samenleving. Wat we hier in het Noorden aanpakken, doen we met volledige aandacht voor mensen die schade ondervinden van gaswinning. Want achter dossiers gaan levens schuil. We tonen begrip en nemen zorgen weg. We handelen af, ondersteunen en geven nazorg. Met gevoel, open, duidelijk en eenvoudig.
Het is onze taak om onafhankelijk te besluiten over aanvragen voor schadevergoeding. Het kan gaan om alle vormen van schade, zoals fysieke schade aan woningen en gebouwen, immateri√´le schade en waardedaling van woningen en bedrijfspanden. Ook is het IMG verantwoordelijk voor het veiligstellen van acuut onveilige situaties. Bij fysieke schade leggen we de nadruk op herstel om vervolgschade te voorkomen. We handelen schade mild, menselijk en makkelijk af. We zijn gevestigd in Groningen en hebben een tijdelijk projectenkantoor in Assen.
Onze prioriteit is het afhandelen en zoveel mogelijk herstellen van schade die mensen en gebouwen oplopen en hebben opgelopen door de gaswinning uit het Groningenveld of van de gasopslag Norg. De inwoners in de kern van het aardbevingsgebied staan centraal: wij zorgen dat zij zich geholpen, gehoord en begrepen voelen. Het afhandelen van schade doen wij mild, menselijk, makkelijk en deskundig. Zo bouwen wij als IMG mee aan perspectief voor de regio en zijn bewoners.
Primary Description: Instituut Mijnbouwschade Groningen ¬∑ Groningen, Groningen, Netherlands (Hybrid)

Title: Security Officer
Description:
Als groep van digitale agencies zijn we afhankelijk van onze hardware, software, systemen en netwerken. Hierin speelt informatiebeveiliging uiteraard een hele grote √©n belangrijke rol. Voor ons IT-team zoeken we een Security Officer die aan de slag gaat met het onderhouden en verbeteren van de informatiebeveiliging binnen onze organisatie en die de ambitie heeft om door te groeien. 

32 tot 40 uur per week | Breda

Wat ga je doen als Security Officer bij Handpicked?

Als Security Officer word je onderdeel van het Handpicked services team en ga je de 12 agencies binnen de groep ondersteunen en adviseren op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging. Je komt terecht in het IT-team, bestaande uit twee Systeembeheerders en de Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). In de rol als Security Officer werk je nauw samen met de CISO, en samen dragen jullie zorg voor het ontwikkelen, implementeren en handhaven van het informatiebeveiligingsbeleid van Handpicked.

Dit is wat je gaat doen:

Je voert risicoanalyses uit en identificeert kwetsbaarheden in systemen en processen;Je stelt richtlijnen en procedures op voor veilig gebruik van systemen en gegevens;Je cre√´ert meer bewustzijn over informatiebeveiliging binnen onze organisatie, bijvoorbeeld door het geven van trainingen; Je onderzoekt en documenteert beveiligingsincidenten en implementeert preventieve maatregelen; Je ondersteunt bij het handhaven van de naleving van wettelijke en branche-gerelateerde normenkaders op het gebied van privacy en informatiebeveiliging, zoals de AVG en de ISO-27001;Je ondersteunt de CISO bij interne en externe audits. 

Jij bent de ideale aanvulling op ons team als je‚Ä¶

een opleiding in de richting van ICT, Cybersecurity of Business IT & Management hebt afgerond;meerdere jaren werkervaring hebt opgedaan op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging; kennis hebt van normenkaders zoals ISO-27001 en ISO-9001;een proactieve instelling hebt en daarbij analytisch en oplossingsgericht te werk gaat; een grote interesse hebt in informatiebeveiliging, graag op de hoogte blijft van ontwikkeling binnen het vak en gemotiveerd bent om jezelf te ontwikkelen; helder en duidelijk kunt communiceren met verschillende stakeholders en een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal hebt. 

Wat heeft Handpicked jou te bieden?

Een salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨3000 en ‚Ç¨4000 per maand (o.b.v. 40 uur), afhankelijk van jouw ervaring;Ruime aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en de mogelijkheid om door te groeien;26 vakantiedagen;Pensioenregeling;Leasefietsregeling;Reizen op jouw manier: een NS Business Card of met je auto tegen een reiskostenvergoeding;Werken bij een organisatie met Great Place To Work certificering in een open en gezellige werkcultuur met veel vrijheid, vertrouwen en verantwoordelijkheid;Werken in een modern kantoor in Breda en iedere dag vers verzorgde lunch in onze Wonderbar;Een persoonlijk budget voor je thuiswerkplek van ‚Ç¨750;Via Openup hebben jij en je (eventuele) gezinsleden toegang tot 1-op-1 sessies met psychologen & lifestyle-experts, en workshops & cursussen voor ondersteuning op het gebied van mentaal welzijn;Je ontvangt bij indiensttreding gratis aandelen van Handpicked, waardoor je mede-eigenaar wordt van onze bureaugroep;Mogelijkheid om 2x per week te bootcampen met een personal trainer;Teamuitjes, borrels, feestjes en talloze andere activiteiten, zoals ons jaarlijkse Handpicked Festival.

Handpicked

Handpicked bestaat uit 12 gespecialiseerde digital agencies, die behoren tot de koplopers in de industrie. Van strategie, design, development, data en (online) marketing tot VR, AR, en AI. Als organisatie groeien we vanuit ondernemerschap en op eigen kracht, zonder afhankelijk te zijn van private equity. We focussen ons op kwaliteit, innovatie en positieve impact. Vanuit onze missie ‚ÄúChange for the better‚Äù vertellen we verhalen die ertoe doen en cre√´ren we digitale oplossingen die √©cht impact maken. Alle agencies hebben hun eigen unieke identiteit, team van specialisten, klanten en subcultuur. Daarbij werken we als Handpicked teams ge√Øntegreerd samen op groepsklanten als Nespresso en Cortina en vindt er onderling veel kennisdeling plaats. Handpicked is al 3 jaar op rij nr. 1 agency groep in de Emerce100 en is in 2024 uitgeroepen tot Best Place To Work.

Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Amandine door te bellen of appen naar 06-14339916.

Vanwege onze kwaliteitsnormen vragen wij je om een VOG aan te vragen als je bij ons in dienst treedt.

Title: Physical Security Officer (m/f/d)
Description:
About Us

MOBIS Parts Europe N.V. is the European branch of Hyundai MOBIS, a worldwide leading supplier of genuine parts and accessories in the field of automotive. Together with Hyundai Motors and Kia Motors, Hyundai MOBIS is one of the biggest companies within the Hyundai group. In addition to research and development of high-tech products for passenger cars, MOBIS Parts Europe N.V. is responsible for the whole aftersales business of genuine parts and accessories for Hyundai Motors and Kia Motors in Europe.

Your profile

At least 3 years of experience in physical security, with a mandatory background in relevant companies or roles. University degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs) in a relevant field is required.Electrical engineering or IT training is an advantage. BT certificate and TPO certificate are required. Certificate of professional competence according to Law 473/2005 Coll is an advantage. Strong knowledge of ISO 45001 and TISAX standards is mandatory. Experience in manufacturing companies or research institutes is advantageous. Intermediate proficiency in English is mandatory and ability to communicate in Korean is required. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is required. A valid driving license (Class B) is required, with active driving experience. Must be able to use CAD/drawing


Your tasks

Execute the primary planning and control authority for physical security across European operations, coordinating with Korean headquarters and European subsidiaries. Plan /Initiate relevant national administrative offices on security matters. Identify assess, and manage physical security risks, ensuring compliance with security standards across all European sites. Manage regular inspections and audits to monitor and enforce physical security protocols and standards. Implement and Supervise the physical security measures during the construction of new plants and facilities. Manage and collaborate with external companies for the installation, maintenance, and revision of physical security equipment. Review ,prepare and enforce internal security policies and regulations to align with company objectives and legal requirements. Manage the classification and protection of information assets and documents, working with IT to prevent information leakage. Manage company security zones (security zone marking and control criteria, entry and exit rules for people and vehicles, access rights management processes, management and operation of surveillance security systems (CCTV)) Coordinate external security services (existing plant protection standards) Update or create new ones, identify and resolve routine operational issues) Manage Internal and external security audits (preparation, execution and cooperation with parent company) 


What we offer you

You will become an important member of an international company that is strongly focusing on the development of the latest automotive technologies Take on an exciting position that will directly impact the company‚Äôs direction in the automotive industry Long-term career perspective and promising growth opportunities Flexible work time model that ensures an attractive work-life balance Modern office space with table tennis room, thinking room, fully equipped meeting rooms Cafeteria area stocked daily with lunch snacks, fresh fruits; in addition, meal vouchers given monthly Many corporate benefits including discount on nearby gym membership Regular company events, team dinners, yearly sports competition Company pension and Linked & Learning Trainings
