Title: Programme Officer, Energy Security (S)
Description:
Background

This position is open for secondment only and participating States are kindly reminded that all costs in relation to an assignment at the Secretariat must be borne by their authorities.

Candidates should, prior to applying, verify with their respective nominating authority to which extent financial remuneration and/or benefit packages will be offered. Seconded staff members in the OSCE Secretariat and Institutions are not entitled to a Board and Lodging Allowance payable by the Organization.

The OSCE has a comprehensive approach to security that encompasses politico-military, economic and environmental, and human aspects. It therefore addresses a wide range of security-related concerns, including arms control, confidence- and security-building measures, human rights, combating human trafficking, national minorities, democratization, policing strategies, counter-terrorism and economic and environmental activities. All 57 participating States enjoy equal status, and decisions are taken by consensus on a politically, but not legally binding basis.

The OSCE Secretariat in Vienna assists the Chairpersonship in its activities, and provides operational and administrative support to the field operations, and, as appropriate, to other institutions.

The OCEEA deals with economic and environmental issues, including energy, operating under the premise that promoting economic prosperity and co-operation on environmental problems can contribute to international security and stability. The Energy Security Team implements the OCEEA‚Äôs mandates in the field of energy security, in particular with regards to the protection of critical energy infrastructure, the promotion of sustainable energy and energy efficiency and the facilitation of dialogue on energy security issues.

Tasks And Responsibilities

As Programme Officer, Energy Security, you will support OCEEA‚Äôs energy security dialogue, analysis and project activities in the areas of energy security, renewable energy, energy efficiency, protection of critical energy infrastructure from natural and man-made disasters and other aspects of energy security and related challenges.

You will develop, implement and administer projects and activities in the field of energy security by performing a variety of operational activities and conceptual analyses fundamental to the formulation, administration and evaluation of projects and activities, by holding responsibility for project deliverables and team supervision, and by overseeing the work of external experts and negotiating activities with partners.

You will report to the Senior Energy Security Adviser, while the Deputy Co-ordinator/Head of Environmental Activities will act as the second-level supervisor. You will oversee other staff members of the Energy Security Team, including JPOs and interns, including distributing workload, managing performance and guiding development.

More Specifically, You Will Be Tasked With The Following

Analysing current and emerging security related energy issues across the OSCE area including national and regional policies, energy markets and political trends to identify priorities and design effective regional activities and projects to address them;Leading the development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of Extra-budgetary (ExB) projects and Unified Budget (UB) activities; preparing project proposals; defining implementation modalities; forecasting and monitoring expenditures; providing progress reports to donors; and fundraising;Exchanging information and negotiating on energy security related issues with government officials in planning, finance, donor input co-ordination and sectoral functions, as well as with representatives of multilateral and bilateral donor agencies;Appraising, reviewing and adjusting the programme and project outputs and activities to ensure consistency with national, regional and sectoral priorities in energy security, and with available resources; formulating and presenting such proposals on the basis of technical and substantive input in accordance with required format; developing schedules, arrangements and methods for the management of the implementation of programme and project activities, in consultation with the supervisor, technical, substantive and administrative service units;Organizing meetings, technical seminars, and conferences in the area of energy security to support information sharing, dissemination of best practices and exchange of lessons learned, handling technical and logistical arrangements, partner coordination, drafting of agendas, briefs, speeches and meeting reports, and compiling background information and presentations;Preparing briefing papers, reports and drafting speeches and statements to be delivered by the OCEEA senior management, the Secretary General and representatives of the Chairmanship-in-Office on these issues and other relevant areas as required;Providing inputs into the Economic and Environmental Committee and the Economic and Environmental Forum processes and to follow-up activities, including OSCE Ministerial Council negotiations and processes;Performing other duties as assigned.

For more detailed information on the structure and work of the OSCE Secretariat and the OCEEA, please see https://www.osce.org/secretariat and https://www.osce.org/oceea

Necessary Qualifications

Second-level university degree in Economics and/or Business Administration, Law, Geography, Natural or Social Sciences or International Relations, preferably with a focus on energy; a first-level university degree in combination with two additional years of relevant experience will be accepted in lieu of the second-level university degree;A minimum of five years (seven years with a relevant first-level degree) of progressively responsible professional-level experience in the area of energy security and/or economic-environmental development, preferably in an international environment and covering the OSCE region;Demonstrated experience in planning, implementing and managing donor-funded projects;Recognized project management certification would be an asset;Excellent oral and written communication skills in English; knowledge of other OSCE region languages would be an asset;Proven knowledge in project management, writing of speeches and reports;Digital literacy and proficient use of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint), internet;Demonstrated gender awareness and sensitivity, and an ability to integrate a gender perspective into tasks and activities;Ability and willingness to work as a member of team, with people of different cultural, and religious backgrounds, different gender, and diverse political views, while maintaining impartiality and objectivity.

If you wish to apply for this position, please use the OSCE's online application link found under https://vacancies.osce.org/ . If your participating State does not provide the option to apply online for seconded positions, you are kindly requested to submit your offline application form available at https://jobs.osce.org/resources/document/offline-application-form to the respective OSCE delegation whose address can be found at https://www.osce.org/contacts/delegations .

The OSCE retains the discretion to re-advertise/re-post the vacancy, to cancel the recruitment, to offer an appointment with a modified job description or for a different duration.

Only those candidates who are selected to participate in the subsequent stages of recruitment will be contacted.

Please note that vacancies in the OSCE are open for competition only amongst nationals of participating States, please see https://www.osce.org/participating-states .

The OSCE is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce, and encourages the nomination of qualified female and male candidates from all religious, ethnic and social backgrounds.

The OSCE is a non-career organization committed to the principle of staff rotation; therefore, the maximum period of service in this post is 10 years.

Candidates should be aware that OSCE officials shall conduct themselves at all times in a manner befitting the status of an international civil servant. This includes avoiding any action which may adversely reflect on the integrity, independence and impartiality of their position and function as officials of the OSCE. The OSCE is committed to applying the highest ethical standards in carrying out its mandate. For more information on the values set out in OSCE Competency Model, please see https://jobs.osce.org/resources/document/our-competency-model .

Please apply to your relevant authorities well in advance of the deadline expiration to ensure timely processing of your application. Delayed nominations will not be considered. The OSCE can only process Secondment applications that have been nominated by participating States. For queries relating to your application, please refer to the respective delegation as listed here: https://www.osce.org/contacts/delegations . 

Please be aware that OSCE appointments are subject to medical clearance. 

Please be aware that the OSCE does not request payment at any stage of the application and review process.

Title: Security Officer ‚Äì DevSecOps, Breda
Description:
About

A prominent provider of business mobility solutions is seeking a Security Officer ‚Äì DevSecOps to strengthen its IT security framework. With operations spanning multiple regions, this organization focuses on delivering sustainable and efficient mobility services. The IT department plays a crucial role in developing and maintaining security solutions for various business entities, ensuring compliance and resilience in an evolving digital landscape.

Role Overview

As a Security Officer specializing in DevSecOps, you will integrate security best practices into the development lifecycle, ensuring that applications and infrastructure meet high security standards from design to deployment. Your responsibilities will include assessing risks, supporting development teams in implementing security controls, and driving compliance with regulatory requirements.

Key Responsibilities

Promote security awareness across development teams.Assist teams in understanding and applying security requirements.Conduct threat analyses and define appropriate mitigation strategies.Develop and maintain security documentation and compliance reports.Oversee classification and protection of information assets.Provide guidance on security controls within CI/CD pipelines.Collaborate on risk and vulnerability management initiatives.Act as a liaison for third-party security services, such as audits and penetration testing.

Required Qualifications And Experience

Certification in CISSP, CISM, or CISA (CCSP or equivalent is a plus).Strong background in application and operational security.Hands-on experience with security technologies such as IAM, VPN, threat modeling, DDoS protection, and firewalls.Familiarity with cloud security frameworks (e.g., Azure, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure).Proven ability to implement security policies in complex IT environments.Expertise in securing CI/CD pipelines using tools such as SonarQube, Contrast Assess, or GitHub Advanced Security.Experience with ISO 27001, NIST, or IEC 62443 frameworks.Strong problem-solving skills and a structured approach to security challenges.Excellent communication skills in English and Dutch (German is a plus).

Preferred Competencies

Proactive and solution-driven mindset.Ability to collaborate across technical and business teams.Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.Adaptability in fast-paced and complex environments.

Relevant terms: Information Security, Cybersecurity, DevSecOps, Security by Design, Threat Modeling, Risk Management, Vulnerability Assessment, Penetration Testing, Compliance, Security Policies, ISO 27001, NIST, IEC 62443, Cloud Security, IAM (Identity and Access Management), VPN, DDoS Protection, Firewalls, CI/CD Security, Secure Software Development, Security Audits, Incident Response, Security Controls, Data Protection, Secure Coding, Security Documentation, Regulatory Compliance, Security Awareness, Security Automation, Zero Trust Architecture, Application Security, Network Security, Encryption, Security Frameworks, Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC), Cyber Threat Intelligence.

Base Cyber Security assists organizations in building knowledge and capabilities in the field of information security. Supporting organizations in forming robust infosec teams or finding the right cybersecurity experts to meet the organization‚Äôs needs is a significant part of our mission.

We collaborate with security professionals on a global scale for information and cybersecurity positions and projects throughout Europe. Whether you‚Äôre at the beginning of your career in information security, seeking advice for your career path, or looking for guidance on continuous self-development and decision-making, we are here to help and would love to connect with you!

If you haven‚Äôt registered yet, make sure to do so now! Send us your details at via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina. and follow us on X/Twitter@BaseCyberSec to stay updated on our activities and relevant information. By registering yourself in our security community and expressing interest in a specific role, project, or team, you expressly grant us permission to use your data, collected and processed by Base Cyber Security in an ethical and discreet manner, and where necessary, in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Title: Concierge Security Officer
Description:
Job Type: Full-time

Shifts: 4 days on / days 4 off (12 hour shifts), both day and night positions available

Clearance Required: PV Security Clearance

Salary: Salaried position - attractive salary package

Attractive sign-on bonus of $5000 over 12 months

Are you ready to step into a role where every day brings a new challenge? We are on the lookout for dynamic and professional individuals to join our team as Concierge Security Officers. Play a crucial role in ensuring the safety, security, and smooth operation of a corporate environment while delivering exceptional customer service. If you're passionate about both security and service, this is the role for you!

Concierge Duties

Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept:

Greet internal and external customers, sign in visitors, and ensure a seamless check-in process.Handle incoming calls, respond to inquiries, and forward calls to the relevant team members.Book and manage meeting rooms through an online system to ensure smooth operation.Assist with CCTV footage requests and conduct routine floor checks to ensure safety.Conduct car park patrols and ensure all areas are secure.Provide escorts for guests and contractors, ensuring they have appropriate access.Monitor site access, ensuring unauthorized individuals do not enter.Provide regular updates to clients regarding service delivery progress.Develop strong relationships with the client and foster an excellent work culture.Address client complaints, ensuring all issues are resolved and documented effectively.Suggest process improvements to enhance service delivery and team performance.Write detailed and clear incident reports, hazard reports, and shift logs.

Security Officer Duties

Conduct internal and external patrols, ensuring the safety of the premises.Supervise and escort contractors/vendors, maintaining security protocols.Respond to incidents including medical emergencies, fire alarms, and lockdown situations.Manage locker facilities, report faults, and ensure security systems are functioning.Handle investigations and spot checks, ensuring compliance with security procedures.

What You Bring To The Table

Title: Security Officer
Description:
Exciting Opportunity:  G4S Secure Solutions Ireland

Position: Security Officer

Location: Kerry

Basic Pay: ‚Ç¨14.50 per hour

Additional Pay: Sunday Premium + ‚Ç¨3.44 per hour, unsociable hours, overtime, bank holiday pay.

Hours: 24+

Schedule: Fully flexible to cover 24/7

Due to the nature of the role, a full clean Irish Driving Licence is required for this role.

Are you looking for an exciting and rewarding career in the security industry? At G4S Secure Solutions Ireland, we offer more than just a job ‚Äì we provide an opportunity to be part of a world-leading security company with endless possibilities for growth and success. We‚Äôre seeking dynamic and professional Security Officers to join our team and make a real difference in safeguarding our clients‚Äô properties, assets, and people. If you have a passion for security, enjoy taking on challenges, and want to play a key role in protecting what matters, this is the opportunity for you!

Why G4S?

Diverse & Engaging Work:

No two days are the same! You‚Äôll be securing a variety of exciting sites across Ireland, from high-profile locations to local businesses.

Training & Development: 

We invest in your future with ongoing training and opportunities to grow within the security field.

Impactful Role: 

You will be a crucial part of the team, helping to provide peace of mind to clients and the communities you serve.

What You‚Äôll Do:

Carry out security patrols to ensure the safety and protection of the site, personnel, and visitors.

Monitor CCTV and access control systems, identifying potential risks and responding proactively.

Handle alarms, incidents, and emergencies with a calm and professional approach. Provide outstanding customer service while maintaining a vigilant, security-focused mindset. - Accurately document incidents and report suspicious activities in real-time.

Collaborate with emergency services as needed to resolve situations quickly and effectively.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

PSA Licence: Valid PSA Security Guarding license

Screening and vetting: 5 Years of verifiable employment and personal activity

Relevant experience: Previous security experience in Ireland

Personal Attributes: Strong communication skills, with the ability to stay composed under pressure. A proactive attitude, attention to detail, and a commitment to excellence. A professional appearance and a passion for delivering high-quality security services.

Flexibility: Flexible to work a variety of shifts, including days, nights, weekends, and public holidays.

Observation Skills: Ability to notice unusual behavior or activities. - Keen attention to detail in monitoring premises and identifying potential threats.

Communication Skills: Clear verbal and written communication for reporting incidents or speaking with the public. Active listening skills to understand instructions and respond appropriately.

Conflict Resolution: Calm demeanor to defuse tense situations and avoid escalation. Ability to mediate disputes and find peaceful resolutions.

Customer Service Skills: Friendly, professional approach when interacting with visitors, employees, or clients. Ability to provide assistance and answer questions politely.

Emergency Response: Knowledge of emergency procedures, including first aid, CPR, and evacuation plans. Ability to stay composed in high-stress or crisis situations.

Report Writing: Ability to document incidents, write clear and concise reports, and maintain records. Understanding of legal and company-specific reporting standards.

Technology Proficiency: Familiarity with security systems such as alarms, CCTV cameras, and access control systems. Basic understanding of office software for report generation and communication.

Surveillance and Monitoring: Proficient in using surveillance equipment and monitoring software to detect suspicious activity. Ability to monitor and control access points and secure areas.

Problem-Solving: Quick thinking in emergency situations to assess risk and take appropriate action. Ability to identify and mitigate security threats proactively.

Teamwork: Ability to collaborate effectively with other security officers, law enforcement, or emergency services. Ability to work in team-based environments to ensure overall safety.

Attention to Detail: Ability to notice minor details that might indicate a larger security threat. Consistent attention to routine tasks to ensure ongoing security.

Crisis Management: Ability to remain calm and take charge in high-pressure situations. Skill in managing evacuations, handling crowd control, and coordinating with authorities.

Time Management: Efficiently balancing patrolling duties, monitoring, and administrative tasks. Managing multiple tasks and prioritizing when necessary. These skills help security officers ensure safety and respond appropriately to any potential threat or emergency.

What‚Äôs on offer:

Recognition Programme awards

Long service awards

Star of the month awards Pension Scheme

Financial Assistance

Title: Security Officer ‚Äì privacy, Assen
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een deskundige op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging en privacy om ons team te versterken. In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het uitvoeren van risico- en GAP-analyses, het ontwikkelen van verbeterplannen, en het rapporteren over de huidige stand van zaken op het gebied van beveiliging en privacy binnen de organisatie. Daarnaast bied je ondersteuning bij de afhandeling van beveiligingsincidenten en privacygerelateerde verzoeken, zoals datalekken en AVG-aanvragen. Ook speel je een belangrijke rol in het vergroten van het bewustzijn rondom informatiebeveiliging en privacy bij medewerkers, onder andere door het geven van trainingen en presentaties.

Je zult nauw samenwerken met verschillende afdelingen binnen de organisatie en fungeren als het eerste aanspreekpunt voor vragen en ondersteuning op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging. Daarnaast draag je bij aan de operationele ondersteuning van projecten rondom compliance en digitale dienstverlening.

Vereisten Voor Deze Rol

HBO werk- en denkniveau met ten minste twee jaar relevante werkervaring in informatiebeveiliging.In het bezit van een certificering zoals CISM, CISSP of vergelijkbaar.Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren van risicoanalyses en het implementeren van verbetermaatregelen.

Competenties

Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden; je bent in staat om complexe informatie op een begrijpelijke manier over te brengen aan zowel technisch onderlegde als niet-technische collega‚Äôs.Overtuigingskracht om het belang van informatiebeveiliging en privacy binnen de organisatie uit te dragen.Gestructureerd en nauwkeurig werken; je weet prioriteiten te stellen en je werkzaamheden volgens een geplande aanpak uit te voeren.Zelfstandigheid en een proactieve houding; je neemt initiatief en lost problemen op door tijdig de juiste hulp in te schakelen wanneer nodig.

Wensen

Ervaring met informatiebeveiliging binnen digitale dienstverlening van overheidsorganisaties is een pre.Kennis van relevante onderwerpen zoals BIO, DNSSEC, TLS en HSTS, of de motivatie om je deze snel eigen te maken.Ervaring met data-analyse en rapportage is een voordeel.Bekendheid met agile werkmethodieken, al is dit geen vereiste.

Relevante termen: informatiebeveiliging, privacy, risicomanagement, GAP-analyse, verbeterplannen, BIO, AVG, datalekken, risicobeoordeling, compliance, incidentmanagement, CISM, CISSP, DNSSEC, TLS, HSTS, gegevensbescherming, digitale dienstverlening, beveiligingsbeleid, security awareness, privacybeleid, audit, ISO27001, cyberbeveiliging, beveiligingsincidenten, data-analyse, rapportage, agile werken, technische beveiligingsmaatregelen.

Base Cyber Security helpt organisaties bij het opbouwen van kennis en capaciteiten op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging. Het ondersteunen van organisaties bij het samenstellen van sterke infosec-teams of het vinden van de juiste cybersecurity-experts voor de behoeften van de organisatie is een essentieel aspect hiervan.

We werken samen met security professionals op wereldwijd niveau voor informatie- en cybersecurityposities en projecten in heel Europa. Of je nu aan het begin van je carri√®re in informatiebeveiliging staat, advies nodig hebt voor de volgende stappen in jouw loopbaan, of wilt weten hoe je jezelf het beste kunt blijven ontwikkelen en de juiste beslissingen kunt nemen, we staan klaar om te helpen en komen graag met jou in contact!

Als je nog niet bent geregistreerd, zorg er dan voor dat je dat nu doet! Stuur ons jouw gegevens via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina. en volg ons op X/Twitter@BaseCyberSec om op de hoogte te blijven van onze activiteiten en relevante informatie. Door jezelf te registreren bij onze securitygemeenschap en interesse te tonen in een specifieke rol, project of team, geef je ons expliciete toestemming om jouw gegevens te gebruiken, die Base Cyber Security verzamelt en verwerkt op een ethische en discrete manier, en indien nodig in overeenstemming met de Algemene Verordening Gegevensbescherming (AVG).

Title: Security Officer
Description:
Telespazio Belgium can count on almost 40 years of experience in the field of Space Operations Service & Engineering activities. We provide a significant contribution to the most major Space programs of the European Space Agency. Our core business is to work on the ground to build bridges into space, contributing to the success of ambitious missions.Telespazio Belgium is looking for a highly skilled Security Officer to work in Transinne, Belgium. Applicants must be eligible to obtain Security clearance from EU country.What is expect:The Security Officer has the responsibility for the implementation of the Security Directives within the Security Zone for which he/she is responsible.The candidate Security Officer, with sufficient professional knowledge and expertise, to the Head of the Security Office for endorsement. The candidate will receive a dedicated briefing from the Security Office and shall be submitted to an exam. If successful, he/she is formally endorsed.The Security Officer has the final formal responsibility for the protection of Classified Information within his/her area of responsibility. For this reason, the Officer shall have direct access to the Information Protection Policy Officer and shall report requests or hierarchical pressure to violate or circumvent the applicable rules and procedures related to the protection of Classified Information.The Security Officer shall make a threat assessment and risk analysis related to the Security Zone he/she is responsible for.The Security Officer is responsible for ensuring the security briefing of personnel being granted a PSC in his/her area of responsibility. In addition, he/she shall provide a security briefing for all personnel requiring access to the Area under his/her responsibility.The Security Officer is responsible for setting up and maintaining a security awareness programme for all personnel in his/her area of responsibility and shall keep records of the training/briefings provided and the attendance.The Security Officer is responsible for producing and maintaining the SECOPS for the Security Zone he/she is responsible for. These SECOPS are subject to the formal approval of the Head of the Security Office, prior to being operationally implemented.The Security Officer shall liaise close with the Policy Officers of the Security OfficeWhat you offer:Master‚Äôs degree in Information Security, IT, or a related field.At least 10 years of experience in information security, compliance and Security Clearance ESA SECRET.The candidate shall possess experience with Certification ISO 27001 Cryptographic Experience is highly reccomanded Experience with governmental Authorities, ESA directives Direct experience with BEL NSA regulationsExperience with Classified Transport Fluent in English and French languages Willingness to travelApplicants must be eligible to obtain Security clearance from EU countryWhat we offerA permanent contract;A competitive salary;A career development (Coursera membership + training budget);A 40-hour working week;A travel allowance;A medical insurance;Meal voucher and Eco voucher;A good relocation packageWhereYou will be working within ESEC, the European Space Agency‚Äôs offices in Belgium as a contractor for Telespazio Belgium. We don‚Äôt expect the employees to be on-site full time however you will still have to relocate to Belgium for this position.
WhenExpected starting date: Coming Soon!
Please note that interviews will be held either via skype, webex, other digital platforms or onsite in person.We look forward to receiving your application for this position!

Title: (Junior) Technical Security Officer
Description:
Security is alles, vooral in een wereld vol cyberdreigingen. Jij weet als ICT-professional als geen ander hoe belangrijk het is om je systemen te beschermen. Klaar om een gamechanger te zijn en de security van onze ICT naar een hoger niveau te tillen? Dan willen wij jou aan boord!

Wolfheze

32-36 uur

ICT

 Wat ga je doen? 

Weet jij wat security en compliancy inhouden en wil je bijdragen aan de veiligheid in het maatschappelijke domein? Weet je hoe je cyberaanvallen kunt aanpakken en terugdringen? En wil jij je collega‚Äôs helpen met hun vragen en bewustwording op het gebied van cybersecurity? Lees dan snel verder.

Als Technical Security Officer bij Pro Persona doe je voorstellen voor het continu verbeteren van de ICT- beveiliging. Je werkt intensief samen met de information security officer om informatiebeveiligingsbeleid te vertalen naar specifieke technische securityrichtlijnen, die gebruikt kunnen worden door beheer- en ontwikkelteams. Je co√∂rdineert daarbij security gerelateerde trajecten en bewaakt actief de opzet en werking van beveiligingsmaatregelen.

Met jouw ervaring op het gebied van Azure, M365, netwerken, SaaS, NEN7510, NIS2 ben je in staat belangrijke concrete technische beveiligingsmaatregelen te signaleren. Je stelt security policies op en beschrijft ze in heldere taal. Je begrijpt dat er een gezonde balans tussen veiligheid en gebruiksvriendelijkheid moet zijn. Daarom ga je pragmatisch te werk en overweeg je elke securitymaatregel zorgvuldig. Je begeleidt de implementatie van de maatregelen en bewaakt de inrichting daarvan. Daarnaast begeleid je de externe support- en beheerteams en adviseer je het management in technische vraagstukken over informatiebeveiliging.

In jouw rol krijg je veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Je bent betrokken bij belangrijke projecten voor het verder beveiligen en verbeteren van de ICT-infrastructuur. Je werkzaamheden zijn afwisselend, waarbij jouw brede kennis optimaal tot recht komt. Je draagt bij aan een visie op de informatiebeveiliging en vertaalt dit naar passende technische (beheer-)maatregelen. Je houdt toezicht op de naleving van de inrichting en stelt verbeterplannen op die je monitort. Je geeft gevraagd en ongevraagd advies aan de verantwoordelijke managers van de organisatie ten aanzien van informatiebeveiliging.

Kortom, met jouw expertise, ambitie en energie kun je √©cht het verschil maken bij Pro Persona!

 Waar ga je werken? 

De afdeling ICT is in ontwikkeling. Momenteel maakt de afdeling de transitie door naar een modernere structuur, waarbij een onderverdeling wordt gemaakt naar de disciplines ‚ÄòService Delivery‚Äô en ‚ÄòInformatie Management‚Äô. Service Delivery verzorgt de operationele ondersteuning aan de directe collega‚Äôs van Pro Persona en indirecte collega‚Äôs die, onder regie van Pro Persona, een directe samenwerking hebben. Informatie Management analyseert en vertaalt de informatiebehoefte van de organisatie naar (nieuwe) informatiestromen, al dan niet ondersteund met (nieuwe) applicaties. Beide disciplines werken nauw samen met een team van Architecten en Securityspecialisten. Het 3e lijns beheer voor Infrastructuur en netwerk is uitbesteed.

Microsoft 365 en Azure vormen de technologische basis van de ICT-omgeving. Met deze moderne infrastructuur hebben we de basis voor een moderne werkplek voor alle collega‚Äôs. Met een proactieve benadering biedt het ICT-team ondersteuning aan de ruim 3500 collega‚Äôs binnen Pro Persona en de Pompestichting.

De standplaats van ICT is Wolfheze, waarbij we uitgaan van een goede balans tussen werken op de diverse locaties van Pro Persona en werken vanuit thuis. De afdeling is onderdeel van Pro Persona Services (PPS), de verzamelnaam van alle ondersteunende diensten binnen Pro Persona. Afdelingen als Communicatie, HR, Huisvesting, Facilitair en ICT maken deel uit van Pro Persona Services.

De Pro Persona Groep is een op ontwikkeling gerichte GGZ-instelling in Gelderland, met meer dan 3.500 medewerkers in Arnhem, Ede, Nijmegen, Tiel, Veenendaal en Wolfheze. We behandelen cli√´nten zoveel mogelijk thuis. Alleen als het √©cht niet anders kan, nemen we op.

 Wat bieden wij jou? 

Wij bieden een jaarcontract met intentie tot verlenging voor 32-36 uur per week met een aantrekkelijk salaris tot ‚Ç¨85.000 bruto per jaar (incl. 13e maand en vakantiegeld), op basis van een 36-urige werkweek, met inschaling op basis van jouw ervaring. Een prettige en collegiale werkomgeving waarin wij onze medewerkers stimuleren om zich te ontplooien en de samenwerking met collega‚Äôs en collega-instellingen op te zoeken.

Verder bieden wij:

166 vakantie-uren per jaar bij een fulltime dienstverband, daarnaast nog jaarlijks 35 verlofuren bij een fulltime dienstverband in de vorm van een levensfasebudget. Deze uren kunnen worden gespaard of opgenomen;Vergoedingen voor bijzondere diensten en onkostenvergoedingen voor onder andere reiskosten, woon-werk en zakelijke dienstreizen, studiekosten en beroepskosten;Een jaarlijks balansbudget van ‚Ç¨500,- naar rato van je dienstverband om te besteden aan dat waar jij blij van wordt. Extra vrije dagen, een cursus of uit eten met vrienden; de keuze is aan jou;Een meerkeuzesysteem arbeidsvoorwaarden (MKA); hiermee kun je de (aanschaf)kosten fiscaal verruilen voor bijvoorbeeld, sportabonnement, reiskosten woon-werkverkeer, studie of opleiding, ICT-middelen zoals PC of tablet, fiets en vakbondscontributie;


Onze verdere arbeidsvoorwaarden vind je hier en zijn conform de CAO GGZ.

 Wat vragen wij van jou? 

Ben jij de technical securityspecialist in onze omgeving veilig houdt voor onze medewerkers? Werk jij soepel samen met het team? Kan jij de functie van key player vervullen in onze beheeromgeving? Dan ben jij misschien wel de geschikte persoon!

Opleidingseisen:

Je hebt een afgeronde relevante hbo-opleiding;Aantoonbare ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie.


Kennis- en Ervaringseisen:

Je hebt HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau;Jij bent resultaatgericht, omgeving bewust en klantgericht;Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare omgeving;Je hebt of werkt aan tenminste √©√©n van de volgende certificeringen:Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP);Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP);Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA);Certified Information Security Manager (CISM);Je hebt operationele kennis van Azure, M365, netwerken, SaaS-oplossingen, NEN7510, NIS2;Je hebt kennis van en ervaring met het opstellen en beschrijven van policies.


Competenties:

Je hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen;Je bent een doorzetter en bent leergierig;Je hebt een flinke dosis creativiteit en denkt buiten de standaard kaders;Je bent communicatief sterk en overtuigend in woord en geschrift;Je bent kwaliteitsgericht, resultaatgericht en pragmatisch.


Ben je een schoolverlater of net afgestudeerd zonder ervaring? Geen probleem! Wij verwelkomen je sollicitatie. Je krijgt begeleiding van onze senior technical security officer en een mooie kans om een zelfstandige rol op te bouwen met veel vrijheid. Je werkt in een moderne omgeving met de nieuwste tools en technieken, zoals Microsoft 365, en je hebt de kans om samen te werken met Informatie Beveiliging & Privacy. Onze ambitie? De meest moderne ICT-werkplek binnen de GGZ cre√´ren.

 Contact 

Neem voor meer informatie contact op met: Gidi Bullens | Manager ICT | 06 15 87 71 88 | g.bullens@propersona.nl

 Procedure 

De vacature wordt tegelijk intern en extern gepubliceerd. Interne en externe sollicitaties zullen tegelijkertijd in behandeling worden genomen, waarbij interne kandidaten voorrang hebben boven externe kandidaten.

We laten de vacature openstaan tot we de juiste match gevonden hebben met jou als onze nieuwe collega.

N.B. Je krijgt altijd een reactie op je sollicitatie! Controleer regelmatig je spam box. Het kan helaas voorkomen dat onze mail daarin terechtkomt.

Wij stellen acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie niet op prijs, delen in je netwerk wel!

Title: Security Officer
Description:
Exciting Opportunity:  G4S Secure Solutions Ireland

Position: Security Officer

Location: Limerick

Basic Pay: ‚Ç¨14.50 per hour

Additional Pay: Sunday Premium + ‚Ç¨3.44 per hour, unsociable hours, overtime, bank holiday pay.

Hours: 24+

Schedule: Fully flexible to cover 24/7

Due to the nature of the role, a full clean Irish driving licence is required.

Are you looking for an exciting and rewarding career in the security industry? At G4S Secure Solutions Ireland, we offer more than just a job ‚Äì we provide an opportunity to be part of a world-leading security company with endless possibilities for growth and success. We‚Äôre seeking dynamic and professional Security Officers to join our team and make a real difference in safeguarding our clients‚Äô properties, assets, and people. If you have a passion for security, enjoy taking on challenges, and want to play a key role in protecting what matters, this is the opportunity for you!

Why G4S?

Diverse & Engaging Work:

No two days are the same! You‚Äôll be securing a variety of exciting sites across Ireland, from high-profile locations to local businesses.

Training & Development: 

We invest in your future with ongoing training and opportunities to grow within the security field.

Impactful Role: 

You will be a crucial part of the team, helping to provide peace of mind to clients and the communities you serve.

What You‚Äôll Do:

Carry out security patrols to ensure the safety and protection of the site, personnel, and visitors.

Monitor CCTV and access control systems, identifying potential risks and responding proactively.

Handle alarms, incidents, and emergencies with a calm and professional approach. Provide outstanding customer service while maintaining a vigilant, security-focused mindset. - Accurately document incidents and report suspicious activities in real-time.

Collaborate with emergency services as needed to resolve situations quickly and effectively.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

PSA Licence: Valid PSA Security Guarding license

Screening and vetting: 5 Years of verifiable employment and personal activity

Relevant experience: Previous security experience in Ireland

Personal Attributes: Strong communication skills, with the ability to stay composed under pressure. A proactive attitude, attention to detail, and a commitment to excellence. A professional appearance and a passion for delivering high-quality security services.

Flexibility: Flexible to work a variety of shifts, including days, nights, weekends, and public holidays.

Observation Skills: Ability to notice unusual behavior or activities. - Keen attention to detail in monitoring premises and identifying potential threats.

Communication Skills: Clear verbal and written communication for reporting incidents or speaking with the public. Active listening skills to understand instructions and respond appropriately.

Conflict Resolution: Calm demeanor to defuse tense situations and avoid escalation. Ability to mediate disputes and find peaceful resolutions.

Customer Service Skills: Friendly, professional approach when interacting with visitors, employees, or clients. Ability to provide assistance and answer questions politely.

Emergency Response: Knowledge of emergency procedures, including first aid, CPR, and evacuation plans. Ability to stay composed in high-stress or crisis situations.

Report Writing: Ability to document incidents, write clear and concise reports, and maintain records. Understanding of legal and company-specific reporting standards.

Technology Proficiency: Familiarity with security systems such as alarms, CCTV cameras, and access control systems. Basic understanding of office software for report generation and communication.

Surveillance and Monitoring: Proficient in using surveillance equipment and monitoring software to detect suspicious activity. Ability to monitor and control access points and secure areas.

Problem-Solving: Quick thinking in emergency situations to assess risk and take appropriate action. Ability to identify and mitigate security threats proactively.

Teamwork: Ability to collaborate effectively with other security officers, law enforcement, or emergency services. Ability to work in team-based environments to ensure overall safety.

Attention to Detail: Ability to notice minor details that might indicate a larger security threat. Consistent attention to routine tasks to ensure ongoing security.

Crisis Management: Ability to remain calm and take charge in high-pressure situations. Skill in managing evacuations, handling crowd control, and coordinating with authorities.

Time Management: Efficiently balancing patrolling duties, monitoring, and administrative tasks. Managing multiple tasks and prioritizing when necessary. These skills help security officers ensure safety and respond appropriately to any potential threat or emergency.

What‚Äôs on offer:

Recognition Programme awards

Long service awards

Star of the month awards Pension Scheme

Employee Assistance Programme:

Legal Assistance

Financial Assistance

Consumer Advice

Career Guidance

Life Coaching

Mediation

Support for Non-Irish Nationals & their Families

Health Advice, including Physio, Podiatrists and Dietitians.

Advice on practical, day to day issues and services

Ready to Take the Next Step? If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of a challenging and fulfilling career with G4S, apply today and start your journey with one of the world‚Äôs leading security providers.

G4S Secure Solutions Ireland is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace for all.

Apply today, if a suitable match is found one of our team will be in touch to discuss further.

Title: Product Security Officer
Description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.

Role And Responsibilities

The Product Security Officer (PSO) is responsible for the overall cyber security and information security program within R&D for Product & Services, both Product Management & Development and Digital Services.

This role will ensure that our products meet rigorous security standards, uphold customer trust, and future-proof our business amid increasing regulatory and security demands.

The Role Also Includes

Develop and drive the overall cybersecurity strategy for product and software development across PMD and DS including incident management.Ensuring regulatory compliance with relevant regulations and other industry frameworks.Establish and enforce secure software development lifecycle practices to embed security from concept to deployment.Assurance, Training & Awareness and Follow up

Qualifications

To be successful in this role we believe that you have:

Master‚Äôs or equivalent degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related technical field. Relevant experience in cybersecurity or information security, in a leadership role overseeing product or software security in a complex, global organization.Expertise in implementing and managing security frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, RED, CRA, NIST, GDPR etc).Proficiency in cloud security architecture, risk management, and regulatory compliance.Experience with operational technology (OT), Edge, IoT and cloud environmentsCertifications such as CSSLP, CISSP, CISM or equivalent are highly desirable.

The role also requires a proven ability to lead diverse teams and foster cross-functional collaboration across departments. Strong communication skills are essential to translate complex technical security concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders. A strategic mindset is also key, enabling you to balance immediate security needs with long-term goals effectively.

 Working at DeLaval 

Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge ‚Äì it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.

We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.

Additional Information

This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval‚Äôs headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.

We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us.

 Contact 

Hiring manager: Lars Bergmann, lars.bergmann@delaval.com

HR Business Partner: Elin Fagerstedt, elin.fagerstedt@delaval.com

About DeLaval

Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.

Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.

See more at corporate.delaval.com

We‚Äôre seeking dynamic and professional Security Officers to join our team and make a real difference in safeguarding our clients‚Äô properties, assets, and people. If you have a passion for security, enjoy taking on challenges, and want to play a key role in protecting what matters, this is the opportunity for you!

Why G4S?

Diverse & Engaging Work:

No two days are the same! You‚Äôll be securing a variety of exciting sites across Ireland, from high-profile locations to local businesses.

Training & Development: 

We invest in your future with ongoing training and opportunities to grow within the security field.

Impactful Role: 

You will be a crucial part of the team, helping to provide peace of mind to clients and the communities you serve.

What You‚Äôll Do:

Carry out security patrols to ensure the safety and protection of the site, personnel, and visitors.

Monitor CCTV and access control systems, identifying potential risks and responding proactively.

Handle alarms, incidents, and emergencies with a calm and professional approach. Provide outstanding customer service while maintaining a vigilant, security-focused mindset. - Accurately document incidents and report suspicious activities in real-time.

Collaborate with emergency services as needed to resolve situations quickly and effectively.

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

PSA Licence: Valid PSA Security Guarding license

Screening and vetting: 5 Years of verifiable employment and personal activity

Relevant experience: Previous security experience in Ireland

Personal Attributes: Strong communication skills, with the ability to stay composed under pressure. A proactive attitude, attention to detail, and a commitment to excellence. A professional appearance and a passion for delivering high-quality security services.

Flexibility: Flexible to work a variety of shifts, including days, nights, weekends, and public holidays.

Observation Skills: Ability to notice unusual behavior or activities. - Keen attention to detail in monitoring premises and identifying potential threats.

Communication Skills: Clear verbal and written communication for reporting incidents or speaking with the public. Active listening skills to understand instructions and respond appropriately.

Conflict Resolution: Calm demeanor to defuse tense situations and avoid escalation. Ability to mediate disputes and find peaceful resolutions.

Customer Service Skills: Friendly, professional approach when interacting with visitors, employees, or clients. Ability to provide assistance and answer questions politely.

Emergency Response: Knowledge of emergency procedures, including first aid, CPR, and evacuation plans. Ability to stay composed in high-stress or crisis situations.

Report Writing: Ability to document incidents, write clear and concise reports, and maintain records. Understanding of legal and company-specific reporting standards.

Technology Proficiency: Familiarity with security systems such as alarms, CCTV cameras, and access control systems. Basic understanding of office software for report generation and communication.

Surveillance and Monitoring: Proficient in using surveillance equipment and monitoring software to detect suspicious activity. Ability to monitor and control access points and secure areas.

Problem-Solving: Quick thinking in emergency situations to assess risk and take appropriate action. Ability to identify and mitigate security threats proactively.

Teamwork: Ability to collaborate effectively with other security officers, law enforcement, or emergency services. Ability to work in team-based environments to ensure overall safety.

Attention to Detail: Ability to notice minor details that might indicate a larger security threat. Consistent attention to routine tasks to ensure ongoing security.

Crisis Management: Ability to remain calm and take charge in high-pressure situations. Skill in managing evacuations, handling crowd control, and coordinating with authorities.

Time Management: Efficiently balancing patrolling duties, monitoring, and administrative tasks. Managing multiple tasks and prioritizing when necessary. These skills help security officers ensure safety and respond appropriately to any potential threat or emergency.

Title: Cybersecurity Officer (CYSO) Southern Europe‚Äã (m/f/d)
Description:
CYSO for Southern Europe is responsible to implement cybersecurity strategy and associated measures to ensure business continuity, adherence to necessary mandatory regulations and safe-guarding SHS business in Spain, Italy, Portugal and Greece. The CYSO shall orchestrate and lead necessary cybersecurity measures and activities and support the Zone Mgmt team on all matters related to cybersecurity .

Key Responsibilities:

Understand the evolving local/regional and market specific cybersecurity developments to ensure implementation of the necessary SEU Zone and Country specific Cybersecurity strategy holistically, ensuring local business needs, evolving regulatory landscape and adherence to the global SHS Cybersecurity processes Oversee and actively drive implementation of the corporate cybersecurity strategy in given scope for SEU Zone and Countries (Spain, Portugal, Italy, Greece) Implement strategic priorities related to Cybersecurity according to Zone Strategic Business Plan and Hoshin-Kanri Breakthrough Targets Support identification of mission and business-critical assets, advise organization's leadership on security posture Define and ensure execution of portfolio security strategy for portfolio developed in SEU Zone and Countries Ensure implementation of cybersecurity requirements and local and global cybersecurity best practices for portfolio developed in the organization units in scope Manage and address cybersecurity risks in the portfolio and operations of the organization units in scope Lead local cybersecurity certification/compliance efforts for corresponding legal entities in countries in given scope Support customer requests for completion of security related documentation and related discussions Oversee and assure quality and accuracy of cybersecurity relevant information submitted to customer questionnaires or tenders Actively participate in cybersecurity incident and vulnerability handling procedure Provide expertise to the organization in scope about cybersecurity topics or liaise with other experts across Siemens Healthineers Monitor regulation and local legislation landscape to derive required actions, accordingly, liaise with respective authorities Participate and represent Siemens Healthineers in local security communities in the countries in given scope 

Requirements:

Master's degree in Cybersecurity, Information Security, Computer Science, Business Informatics, or a related field Relevant professional certifications (CISSP, CISM, CISA, GSLS) preferred Work experience > 7 years in cybersecurity or information security areas especially in assessing and implementing security measures Working knowledge and experience with National Cybersecurity Scheme (ENS) certification in Spain preferred

Skills:

Strong knowledge of information security frameworks and standards (ISO 27001, Common Criteria), risk management, and regulatory requirements (NIS2, ENS, Cyber ) Working knowledge of network, application security, secure software development principles and practices Working knowledge of principles and practices for secure operations (monitoring, incident response) Great communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders up to top leadership level, and communicate complex concepts to people in technical and non-technical roles Good analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to think strategically and manage multiple priorities Fluent in spoken and written English, also in discussions on technical topics

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world‚Äôs most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

Our global team: We are a team of 72,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in healthcare to help improve people‚Äôs lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible, to improve people‚Äôs lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. Check our Careers Site at [1] https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-us/careers.

Your day begins by driving cybersecurity resilience across Digital Finance and Regulatory Requirements within Siemens Energy‚Äôs corporate function. You‚Äôll collaborate with various teams to ensure that cybersecurity strategies align with business needs while managing the overall cybersecurity posture for the finance function.

Throughout the day, you‚Äôll provide regular updates to the Chief Cybersecurity Officer and the Executive Board, ensuring they are informed on cyber risks and progress. You‚Äôll define and implement the global cybersecurity strategy for finance, working closely with the CFO to fulfill cybersecurity responsibilities. You‚Äôll engage with stakeholders to identify their cybersecurity needs, ensuring the delivery of robust solutions that support the transformation of digital finance.

How You‚Äôll Make An Impact

Drive cybersecurity resilience for Digital Finance & Regulatory Requirements in the energy sector, ensuring alignment with business demands and global strategyProvide cyber risk reports and regular updates to the Chief Cybersecurity Officer and Executive Board, ensuring visibility and effective decision-makingDefine and implement the global cybersecurity strategy for the Finance function while supporting the CFO in fulfilling cybersecurity responsibilitiesLead the identification and implementation of necessary cybersecurity infrastructure, staffing, and resourcing within the finance functionCollaborate with stakeholders to understand business demands for cybersecurity, driving delivery of robust, future-proof solutionsRepresent cybersecurity in executive meetings, conferences, and with external partners, promoting the strategic importance of cybersecurity across the organization


What You Bring

A university degree or equivalent experience in information technology, cybersecurity, or a related fieldA minimum of 10 years of professional experience in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, or a related field, with broad exposure across different functions and businessesSpecialist knowledge in Digital Finance (SAP Finance environment/treasury management systems) and Regulatory RequirementsProven leadership ability to coach and develop teams, along with strong analytical and strategic thinking to shape cybersecurity initiatives for the futureExperience in working with diverse stakeholders across multiple functions and at various levels, including executive managementBusiness-fluent English language skills, along with local language skills, and a willingness to travel domestically and internationally up to 30% of the time


About The Team

In our Business Functions we enable our organization to reach their targets by providing best-in class services and solutions in the areas of IT, HR, Finance, Real Estate, Strategy & Technology and more.

Who is Siemens Energy? 

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 94,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we‚Äôre also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character ‚Äì no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits

In addition to an attractive remuneration package in line with the market, you can expect an attractive employer-financed company pension scheme.We also offer the opportunity to become a Siemens Energy shareholder.We offer our employees the opportunity to work flexibly and remotely, and our inspiring offices provide space for collaboration and creativity.The professional and personal development of our employees is very important to us. We provide them with the opportunities to learn and develop in a self-determined way, various attractive programs and learning materials are available for this purpose.In relation to the "compatibility of family and work", we have a wide range of offers, e.g. flexible working time models, childcare places at many locations, the possibility of trial part-time work or even a sabbatical


We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.

Title: Security Awareness Officer, Den Bosch
Description:
In de rol van Security Awareness Officer speel je een cruciale rol in het bevorderen van informatiebeveiligingsbewustzijn binnen de organisatie. Je doel is om een cultuur van veiligheid te stimuleren door gedragsverandering te ondersteunen en medewerkers bewust te maken van de noodzaak van informatiebeveiliging.

Je bent een ervaren communicatiespecialist die moeiteloos door de organisatie beweegt en inzicht heeft in de uitdagingen en mogelijkheden van cultuur- en gedragsverandering. Samen met andere bewustwordingsmanagers werk je aan het implementeren van brede cultuur- en gedragsveranderingen binnen de organisatie. Hierbij overwin je weerstand en zorg je ervoor dat beleid en richtlijnen worden nageleefd, ondanks dat deze soms als beperkend worden ervaren.

Vereisten

Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding in gedragsverandering, communicatie, of verandermanagement.Uitgebreide kennis en ervaring op het gebied van cultuur- en gedragsverandering binnen complexe organisaties.Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van communicatiemiddelen.Minimaal 3-5 jaar werkervaring in een organisatie in transitie.

Competenties

Zeer sterk in communicatie, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.Overtuigingskracht en een goed ontwikkeld gevoel voor organisatiesensitiviteit.Vermogen om medewerkers te inspireren en draagvlak te cre√´ren binnen de organisatie.Vaardig in het omgaan met uitdagende vraagstukken en politiek gevoelige omgevingen.

Wensen

Ervaring met het ontwikkelen, bewaken, en uitdragen van een security awareness programma.Bijdragen aan het opstellen van security beleid en toezien op de implementatie van security standaarden en richtlijnen.Adviseren over en bijdragen aan het corporate dreigingsbeeld.Co√∂rdineren van de uitvoering van het security awareness programma en aansturen van betrokken collega‚Äôs.Ontwikkelen van diverse communicatiemiddelen zoals artikelen, presentaties, en video‚Äôs.Geven van workshops en presentaties.

Relevante termen: Informatiebeveiliging, security awareness, cultuur- en gedragsverandering, communicatie in informatiebeveiliging, security beleid, beveiligingsstandaarden, security richtlijnen, corporate dreigingsbeeld, CISO Office, beveiligingsprogramma, netbeheer, gas- en elektriciteitsnetwerk, hybride werken, security workshops, informatiebeveiligingsbeleid, security communicatie, verandermanagement, informatiebeveiligingsbewustzijn,

Base Cyber Security helpt organisaties bij het opbouwen van kennis en capaciteiten op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging. Het ondersteunen van organisaties bij het samenstellen van sterke infosec-teams of het vinden van de juiste cybersecurity-experts voor de behoeften van de organisatie is een essentieel aspect hiervan.

We werken samen met security professionals op wereldwijd niveau voor informatie- en cybersecurityposities en projecten in heel Europa. Of je nu aan het begin van je carri√®re in informatiebeveiliging staat, advies nodig hebt voor de volgende stappen in jouw loopbaan, of wilt weten hoe je jezelf het beste kunt blijven ontwikkelen en de juiste beslissingen kunt nemen, we staan klaar om te helpen en komen graag met jou in contact!

Als je nog niet bent geregistreerd, zorg er dan voor dat je dat nu doet! Stuur ons jouw gegevens via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina. en volg ons op Twitter@BaseCyberSec om op de hoogte te blijven van onze activiteiten en relevante informatie. Door jezelf te registreren bij onze securitygemeenschap en interesse te tonen in een specifieke rol, project of team, geef je ons expliciete toestemming om jouw gegevens te gebruiken, die Base Cyber Security verzamelt en verwerkt op een ethische en discrete manier, en indien nodig in overeenstemming met de Algemene Verordening Gegevensbescherming (AVG).

Title: Security en Privacy Officer
Description:
Ben jij een specialist in informatiebeveiliging en privacy?
Wil jij bijdragen aan de bescherming van vertrouwelijke gegevens van onze inwoners en de continu√Øteit van onze diensten garanderen. Dan is deze functie, waarin je de rol van Privacy Officer (PO) combineert met die van Information Security Officer (ISO) wellicht perfect voor jou! Beide rollen zijn evenredig in omvang en bevatten zowel adviserende, uitvoerende als ondersteunende taken.

Als Security en Privacy Officer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen, implementeren en handhaven van ons informatiebeveiligings- (IB) en Privacybeleid. Je werkt samen met de Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) en de Functionaris Gegevensbescherming (FG), maar ook met de Technical Information Security Officer (TISO) en de adviseurs informatiemanagement en procesmanagement. Samen bewaken en verbeteren jullie de informatieveiligheid binnen de gemeente Deurne.

Wat ga je doen?Je adviseert de CISO en FG over relevante ontwikkelingen.Je bent het eerste aanspreekpunt voor IB- en Privacy-vragen van medewerkers.Je ondersteunt de CISO en FG bij het identificeren van risico‚Äôs en het adviseren over beheersmaatregelen.Je beheert en onderhoudt het verwerkingsregister en ondersteunt bij het opstellen van verwerkersovereenkomsten en het formuleren van IB en Privacy eisen bij inkoop en aanbesteding.Je beheert en onderhoudt het Privacy- en Information Security Management System (PISMS).Je stelt IB- en Privacy processen en -procedures op.Je ondersteunt het management bij de uitvoering en het vastleggen van risicoanalyses en DPIA‚Äôs.Je adviseert en ondersteunt het management bij de implementatie en uitvoering van IB- en Privacy beleid en maatregelen.Je adviseert en ondersteunt het management bij de afhandeling van IB-incidenten en datalekken, inclusief de registratie, analyse en verbetering van maatregelen.Je ondersteunt de CISO en FG bij rapportages.Je wisselt extern kennis en ervaring uit met vakgenoten van andere gemeenten en met de informatiebeveiligingsdienst (IBD).

Deze talenten neem je meeJe hebt een hbo-/wo-werk- en -denkniveau, bij voorkeur in een relevante richting (zoals ICT, Rechten, Bestuurskunde of Security Management).Je hebt minimaal twee jaar werkervaring in een informatiebeveiligings- of privacyfunctie.Je hebt aantoonbare werkervaring met het uitvoeren van risicoanalyses en/of DPIA‚Äôs en in een omgeving van het openbaar bestuur.Je hebt kennis van de Baseline Informatiebeveiliging Overheid (BIO), ISO 27001/2 (Internationale standaarden voor informatiebeveiliging) en NIS2 (Netwerk- en Informatiebeveiliging Richtlijn).Je hebt kennis van de Algemene verordening gegevensbescherming (AVG) en Wet politiegegevens (Wpg).Certificeringen zoals CISSP, CISM, CIPP/E of vergelijkbaar zijn een pre.De voertaal binnen deze functie is Nederlands, dus beheersing hiervan is essentieel.

Jouw team
Als je bij ons komt werken, kom je terecht in het team Bedrijfsvoering-Ontwikkeling. Een klein team van ca. 8 medewerkers die samen verantwoordelijk zijn voor procesmanagement, informatiemanagement en privacy en informatieveiligheid. Het team heeft als kernwaarden: deskundigheid, creativiteit, betrouwbaarheid, onafhankelijkheid en verbinding. We werken hybride, wat betekent dat je daar bent waar je moet zijn voor je werk. Dat kan dus ook thuis zijn. Samen met je team maak je daar afspraken over.

Op dit moment wordt nagedacht over de inrichting van de organisatie in relatie tot de complexe opgaven waar de gemeente voor staat. Mogelijk heeft dit in de toekomst consequenties voor de samenstelling van de teams en de invulling van de teamleiders.

Wat bieden wijEen passend salaris van minimaal ‚Ç¨ 3602 tot maximaal ‚Ç¨ 5313 bruto per maand op basis van 36 uur per week (schaal 10). Dit is een indicatieve waardering, de functie moet nog worden gewaardeerd. Afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring kan ook inschaling in aanloopschaal 9 plaatsvinden.Een flexibele werkweek tussen de 32 en 36 uur per week.Een individueel keuzebudget bestaande uit vakantiegeld en een eindejaarsuitkering van 17,05% van je bruto salaris.Tegemoetkoming kosten zorgverzekering van ‚Ç¨ 168 of ‚Ç¨ 296 bruto per jaar afhankelijk van je salaris.Een hybride werkplek met goede faciliteiten om thuis te werken, zoals een laptop en telefoon (in bruikleen) en een thuiswerkvergoeding van ‚Ç¨ 3 per dag. Voor het inrichten van je thuiswerkplek bieden we een vergoeding van maximaal ‚Ç¨ 500 netto.Een welkomprogramma waarin je kennis maakt met je collega‚Äôs en om je wegwijs te maken.Een inspirerende werkomgeving in het nieuwe Huis voor de Samenleving met lekkere koffie en een lunch werk-caf√©.Een breed aanbod aan trainingen en e-learnings om je talenten verder te ontwikkelen.Mogelijkheden om deel te nemen aan verlofsparen en om verlof te kopen/verkopen.Pensioenopbouw bij het Algemeen Burgerlijk Pensioenfonds (ABP) en de mogelijkheid om deel te nemen aan de semi-collectieve arbeidsongeschiktheidsverzekering.

Deurne daar doen we het voor
Iedere functie is uniek en elke dag is anders. We kijken naar jouw talenten en bieden mogelijkheden om te blijven groeien en te ontwikkelen. Daar zijn wij trots op! Samen met 300 collega‚Äôs maken we ons Deurne steeds mooier. Elke dag stappen we ons Huis voor de Samenleving binnen waar we elkaar ontmoeten en samenwerken. Een huis waar inwoners, verenigingen, organisaties en de gemeente samen komen. Door de korte lijntjes lopen we gemakkelijk bij elkaar binnen, hierdoor krijgen we veel voor elkaar.

Zin in de volgende stap?
Solliciteer nu en draag bij aan de toekomst van onze gemeente! Hier zijn de stappen om te solliciteren:Solliciteer via het sollicitatieformulier op de website.De deadline is 31 maart 2025Na je sollicitatie laten wij je zo snel mogelijk weten of je wordt uitgenodigd voor een gesprekReserveer maandag 7 april 2025 voor het gesprek. Kun je niet op deze datum? Laat het ons weten, dan vinden we samen een ander geschikt moment.

Heb je vragen over de functie? Dan kun je hierover contact opnemen met Roel Brand, CISO en Adviseur informatiemanagement via telefoonnummer 0493-38 77 11.

Vragen over het sollicitatieproces? Bel Sabrina Walch of Hanriette de Lepper op 0493-38 77 11.

Title: Security Officer
Description:
Nederland aan houden, dat is onze missie. Als Security Officer bij Engineering & Services speel jij een sleutelrol bij het beveiligen van onze projecten binnen de afdeling Large Projects Offshore Netherlands (LON). Binnen TenneT ben jij d√© expert die vanuit technologisch, fysiek √©n menselijk perspectief zorgt voor optimale beveiliging. Ben jij klaar om met jouw expertise bij te dragen aan een veilige energievoorziening van morgen?

Jouw bijdrage aan TenneT

Hoe zorg jij voor een veilige en robuuste werkomgeving binnen TenneT? Als Integrated Security Officer ben je verantwoordelijk voor de integratie en borging van security binnen de LON-businessunit. Met jouw diepgaande kennis en ervaring cre√´er jij een veilige werkomgeving voor collega's en externe partijen. Door te werken aan de integratie van technologische, fysieke en menselijke veiligheidsaspecten versterk je actief onze weerbaarheid tegen huidige en toekomstige risico‚Äôs.

Jouw Belangrijkste Verantwoordelijkheden

Fungeren als primair aanspreekpunt voor alle security-gerelateerde onderwerpen binnen LON.Ontwikkelen, implementeren en updaten van securitybeleid, controles en risicomanagementprocessen samen met interne stakeholders.Optreden als verbindingspersoon met andere TenneT-afdelingen om security-initiatieven te stroomlijnen binnen het corporate ISMS en ISO 27001.Signaleren van hiaten in security-eisen en het implementeren van noodzakelijke verbeteringen.Leiden van en deelnemen aan security assurance activiteiten, waaronder compliance reviews en interne audits.

In deze rol zorg je ervoor dat security niet alleen binnen jouw team, maar ook organisatiebreed topprioriteit blijft. Je draagt bij aan TenneT‚Äôs veiligheidsstrategie door continu bewustzijn en samenwerking rond securitythema‚Äôs te bevorderen.

Jouw profiel en achtergrond

Als Security Officer bij TenneT verwachten we dat jij het verschil maakt. Jij hebt de juiste combinatie van kennis, ervaring en vaardigheden om security naar een hoger niveau te brengen.

Wat breng jij mee?

Afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in Security Management, Veiligheidskunde of vergelijkbaar.Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met security management en ervaring met ISO 27001 (CISSP-certificering is een pr√©).Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in Nederlands √©n Engels.Proactief, analytisch en sterk in stakeholdermanagement.Sterke balans tussen detailgerichtheid en overzicht houden.Ervaring met security audits en compliance trajecten.

Ons recruitment process

In our online-application-form you can apply within only some minutes as long as this job is posted. Afterwards we screen your application and get back to you as soon as possible.

For Further Questions Regarding The Recruiting Process Please Contact

Edward Verkammen

Recruiter - People | Talent Acquisition

Edward.Verkammen@tennet.eu

06 - 4297 2559

For Questions Relating To The Position

Pim Freij

Head Engineering Services - Hiring Manager

Ons aanbod

We are family friendly and flexible

Flexible working hours without fixed times and home office options allow you to organize your work individually. Our external partners also provide you with support services for various phases of life - for example, in matters relating to household services or care and career.

Health - your basis

Because we think it is important that you are healthy and feel good, we offer all kinds of great extras: we provide various opportunities to work out via our Always Energy program which offers a wide range of opportunities to indulge in sports (organised training for different sports, competitions and events). And you will receive a sports allowance if you are a member of a sports club.

Modern working environment

Modern IT-toolsErgonomic workstationsVery well equipped conference rooms and communication solutions that enable cross-location and cross-border collaboration

Attractive Remuneration And Social Benefits

We offer great benefits such as a salary based on our Collective Labor Agreement, an annual bonus and excellent pension scheme.

Personal development

Personal growth is something we actively stimulate within TenneT. For example we have our own TenneT Academy where you can explore and develop your own set of skills. More than that: you have the opportunity to work in an innovative company with an international network, to use your personal strengths and to shape the future together with us.

Onze uitdaging

Large Projects Offshore is a key contributor to the energy transition. The Unit is responsible for the current and future development of the offshore grid as a whole and subsequently for the development and realization of the DC interconnectors and the Offshore Wind Farm grid connections in both the German and Dutch sectors of the North Sea.

Extra informatie

TenneT Biedt Jou De Kans Om Bij Te Dragen Aan Een Duurzame Energietoekomst. Samen Met Collega‚Äôs, Partners En Stakeholders Werk Je Aan Innovatieve Oplossingen Die De Energietransitie Mogelijk Maken. Bij Ons Krijg Je De Ruimte Om Je Talent Te Ontwikkelen En Werk Je In Een Omgeving Waarin Jouw Groei Centraal Staat. We Geloven In Samenwerking, Vooruitdenken En Vernieuwen. Daarom Bieden Wij Jou

Een vast contract voor 40 uur, met twee maanden proeftijd.Een salaris conform schaal 8: ‚Ç¨4.151 tot ‚Ç¨8.197 bruto per maand, met 8% vakantiegeld en 6% eindejaarsuitkering (conform CAO TSO).Een solide pensioen via ABP: wij betalen 70% van jouw premie.43 vakantiedagen per jaar.Alle genoemde arbeidsvoorwaarden gelden bij een fulltime dienstverband, tenzij anders vermeld.

We hechten veel waarde aan een goede werk-priv√©balans en jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Daarom bieden we flexibele oplossingen zoals:

Hybride werken waar mogelijk, met een internet- en een thuiswerkvergoeding.Ondersteuning voor jouw vitaliteit, met een bijdrage voor een sportabonnement en zorgverzekering.Ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden via de TenneT Academy, zodat jij je kennis en vaardigheden kunt blijven uitbreiden.

Wij stimuleren initiatief en geven je de ruimte om met nieuwe idee√´n te komen. Samen zorgen we ervoor dat Nederland in beweging blijft en klaar is voor de energie van morgen.

Ben jij klaar om impact te maken? Solliciteer vandaag nog en word onderdeel van ons team!
